title_review: Interesting, inventive Inclan - delicious food not to be missed!
review_preview: This restaurant was recommended to us by a lady on the door at Rosi La Loca Taberna. We had hoped to eat at Rosi La Loca but it was full and Inclan is owned by the same people.  We were a little unsure whether to...
review_full: This restaurant was recommended to us by a lady on the door at Rosi La Loca Taberna. We had hoped to eat at Rosi La Loca but it was full and Inclan is owned by the same people. We were a little unsure whether to go at first, but my goodness, how glad we were that we did! Our table was a high table with stools in the bar area as the restaurant was full. It was fun being sat there as we got to talk to most of the waiters/waitresses. The staff are all so friendly and helpful, they make you feel very welcome.  We chose 7/8 dishes between 3 of us. This was plenty though I would have loved to have tried more as everything on the menu sounds so appetising. The stand out dishes for us were the Bao Brutal con Carne, Bavette de Ternera and Cajon de Esto No Es Tomate. Everything was absolutely delicious. We also had several mini cocktails and shared a couple of desserts. The desserts were tasty but not as interesting and exciting as the tapas and cocktails were.  This restaurant is very reasonably priced and cost less than €100 for 8/9 dishes, 2 desserts, mini cocktails, beers and a €10 tip.  I highly recommend this restaurant and can’t wait to go back there when we next visit Madrid.

review_preview: My wife and I did a tapas tour, and the Inclan Brutal Bar was the first stop.  The tapas they gave us were very tasty and fresh.  And the drink they gave was very tasty as well.  We proceed to the next two tapas tour...
review_full: My wife and I did a tapas tour, and the Inclan Brutal Bar was the first stop. The tapas they gave us were very tasty and fresh. And the drink they gave was very tasty as well. We proceed to the next two tapas tour bars, but neither were nearly as good as the Inclan Brutal Bar. After the tour, after a few hours had passed, my wife and I decide that when it was time to eat again that we would head back to the Brutal Bar to try other things on their menu. We sat down at a bench type table near the bar, where we had a great view of the kitchen, and we got to watch the bartenders work their magic. We ordered some food, and over time got to know the two bartenders very well — Ruben and Guillermo. Both guys were awesome to talk to, and Ruben is the most impressive mixologist I’ve ever seen. He apparently was the one who created all the drinks, and my wife and I tried quite a few, and we didn’t find one that we didn’t love.   The food was amazing as well. We even told some other people who we met the next day about Brutal Bar, and they ended up telling us they loved it as well. They thanked us for recommending it to them. So if that doesn’t tell you how good this place is, I don’t know what else I can tell you that would convince you. All I can say is that we loved the food, we loved the drinks, and were lucky enough to meet Ruben and Guillermo. It was a great night, and I think it’s a great place to go for some food and drinks.

title_review: A restaurant that serve a delicious meal with a twist, and the only thing that is cheap is the price
review_preview: There is nothing brutal with this bar. Of course, the interior decorator has not tried to get a cosy atmosphere. It is rather rough, but the chairs are nice, and you sit comfortable in them. Even if they have a long drink list it is...
review_full: There is nothing brutal with this bar. Of course, the interior decorator has not tried to get a cosy atmosphere. It is rather rough, but the chairs are nice, and you sit comfortable in them. Even if they have a long drink list it is mostly a restaurant and at our visit it was just dinner guest that we saw.  Most of the starters you could have a small or a large portion. If you want a starter our advice is to pick the small ones, we did and was quite OK with their size. My wife started with a gazpacho that she liked very much. I picked the mysteries box with anything but tomatoes. And it was not. It looked as it was gold painted tomatoes in a tomato sauce. Actually, it was cheese in a sweet sauce. Just delicious. As a main course we picked tuna. It was very nicely served on a boat shaped plate on a wooden bout with shells. It is a could dish. The tuna was perfectly fried and on a small bed of very tasty greens and some dots with a very tasty sauce. You ned the bread with it, but then it was just excellent with a glass of the good Alberino wine. As a desert I picked the crusted chocolate cake and violet ice-cream, this was good but not up to the very high standard of the starters and main courses. This was really a delicious meal with a twist we really appreciated. And they charge just half compared to many other restaurants in this city.

title_review: Great modern fusion of Spanish food
review_preview: I visited the place with my parents-in-law, wife and my 10 month old baby. They gave us a big round table so that we could park the Buggy inside next to our table.The food was delicious and the presentation was extraordinary. One of the...
review_full: I visited the place with my parents-in-law, wife and my 10 month old baby. They gave us a big round table so that we could park the Buggy inside next to our table. The food was delicious and the presentation was extraordinary. One of the dishes we ordered (can't remember the name), came with two slices of ham handing from a horizontal bar and two pieces of small pies with apple sauce under them. The waitress them came with a blow torch and smoked the ham in front of us. it served 2 purposes: 1) smoked the ham, 2) flavored the pie under the ham with the drippings of fat from ham. The location of this place is very close to Plaza Saint Ana. Though it's not a massive place, probably less than 50 people can sit there at the same time, the food and the service is very impressive. During busy season, i'd advise to book this place in advance as it is very popular. Highly recommend.

It's fun to sit outside, and it's nice downstairs in the cellar or dining room. The bar is cool looking too. It's not a very big place and it's pretty popular now, so it's good to make a reservation ahead of time in order to avoid disappointment. Highly recommended. 4.5 stars

review_preview: Due to our travel schedule, we needed a late lunch/early supper around 4 PM. Fortunately, La Mi Venta was open all day and accommodated us. We were one of the few patrons at that time of day, but the owner took care of us personally,...
review_full: Due to our travel schedule, we needed a late lunch/early supper around 4 PM. Fortunately, La Mi Venta was open all day and accommodated us. We were one of the few patrons at that time of day, but the owner took care of us personally, ensuring that we got as much attention (if not more) than those dining during normal eating hours. He showed us to a table downstairs in the cave-like main dining room, which was cozy and well-decorated. He took care to recommend their best dishes along with the best pairing wines. We enjoyed beef, pork and paella, all of which was outstanding. The pork may have been the best I have ever eaten. I understand that this restaurant stays very busy, so reservations are recommended, but we are fortunate to have not needed any at the time we went. The food is terrific, the staff are friendly and helpful--I highly recommend this restaurant.

title_review: Fantastic Flamenco show with superb food
review_preview: This venue was recommended by the concierge at our hotel as the best place to see Flamenco and we booked for dinner.A short taxi ride and we were shown into an intimate restaurant with a stage in one corner.  Tables are very close together...
review_full: This venue was recommended by the concierge at our hotel as the best place to see Flamenco and we booked for dinner. A short taxi ride and we were shown into an intimate restaurant with a stage in one corner. Tables are very close together and although you may not be sat close to the stage, (some tables are booked well in advance!), you will be able to see the show very well. The food is amazing, we both loved every mouthful, the flavours were superb. There is a good wine list too and they have sangria and mojitos. The staff are friendly and attentive although most only speak a little English. The show is amazing and includes singing as well as dancing and guitar solo's. Flamenco is very intense and these performers were seriously good!

review_preview: First time at Flamenco, and we thoroughly enjoyed the energetic dancing and emotional singing. We booked just a few days in advance when only the 'dinner & show' option was available, but the food and wine were both good (we had one of the set...
review_full: First time at Flamenco, and we thoroughly enjoyed the energetic dancing and emotional singing. We booked just a few days in advance when only the 'dinner & show' option was available, but the food and wine were both good (we had one of the set menus). We had dinner at 1900 ahead of a show at 2030, which worked well as it meant the meal was finished before the show began - those who chose the 1930 meal time found the meal and show overlapped. A wonderful show, although one thing to be aware of is that, because of the room layout, your view of the stage may be partially obstructed by pillars. Didn't detract from the enjoyment though.

review_preview: I'm always a bit wary of TA reviews because it often seems to represent Americans from Podunk Kentucky ( no disrespect, I like Kentucky), so though this place was five minutes from our hotel and highly rated, I was skeptical. Monday evening, our last night...
review_full: I'm always a bit wary of TA reviews because it often seems to represent Americans from Podunk Kentucky ( no disrespect, I like Kentucky), so though this place was five minutes from our hotel and highly rated, I was skeptical. Monday evening, our last night in Madrid on a belated honeymoon. The place was empty (bad sign) but we were greeted warmly (good sign). Menu is very small which is a good sign in my book, but most gringos seem to like the Cheesecake Factory/Claim Jumpers 500 item menu. Well, we started with the largest tapas sampler, which was all cured meats and a bit of cheese. These were the best cured meats I've ever tasted (and living in Chicago, I've tasted a lot of cured meat). The Iberian pork steak and beef steak were a bit  fatty, but just delicious. The house wine was a steal, and the desserts were so good, they were gone in literally less than 90 seconds. They finished us off with the Spanish versions of limoncello and bailey's . The feast came in at 90 euros. I would not blink at giving this place a top recommendation.

review_preview: What a fun evening.  Food was excellent especially for a dinner show.  In our experience, usually when you see a show, the dinner isn't great, but this was fantastic.  Waiter was attentive and helpful.  With my husband and 2 daughters and all were able to...
review_full: What a fun evening. Food was excellent especially for a dinner show. In our experience, usually when you see a show, the dinner isn't great, but this was fantastic. Waiter was attentive and helpful. With my husband and 2 daughters and all were able to find something they enjoyed on the menu. Desserts were also fantastic. Only complaint was the show was a little loud. Weren't sure what to expect from a Flamenco show, we really thought the ladies would have dresses with long, ruffled trains, and they did not...... there was a lot of stomping and clapping. This was the one and only Flamenco show we ever saw, so we have nothing to compare it to.... just so you know what you are in for. We went to Seville after Madrid and they said Flamenco is really from there so maybe it's more authentic in feeling there? We didn't want to go again so we don't know for sure. Anyway, all in all, a great and fun time.

review_preview: My friend and I visited Inclán Brutal on Wednesday June 20, 2018 as one of our other friends had recommended the place to us. Helena attended us. At the moment, they were screening one of the World Cup soccer games and the place was full....
review_full: My friend and I visited Inclán Brutal on Wednesday June 20, 2018 as one of our other friends had recommended the place to us. Helena attended us. At the moment, they were screening one of the World Cup soccer games and the place was full. Unfortunately, we had not made reservations and there was no space. My friend insisted and told Helena that we really wanted to try the place and did not mind standing up at the bar. Helena went above and beyond to find a place for us at the bar and surprisingly enough after a few minutes was able to find a table for us. We were extremely grateful, as that was our last day in Madrid and we really wanted to check the place out. On top of that, the service was amazingly fast and our waiter, Patti, was very diligent. The food was also very tasty and exceeded my expectations. I honestly have to say that I was very impressed by the personnel's commitment to their job and to the costumers, especially Helena who, in light of having a full restaurant, essentially did the impossible so that we could experience the bar. I highly recommend it and when I return to Madrid I will definitely return to Inclán.

review_preview: So we arrived a bit late due to a delayed flight.  Our hosts at La Mi Venta were unfazed and quickly settled us into an outdoors table and had the cold drinks in front of us with unfeasible speed.  Our dining experience was great.  The...
review_full: So we arrived a bit late due to a delayed flight. Our hosts at La Mi Venta were unfazed and quickly settled us into an outdoors table and had the cold drinks in front of us with unfeasible speed. Our dining experience was great. The Iberico jamon in particular was very good - and we were told proudly that it had been prepared by Spain's "second best" ham carver! Certainly looked good to me. The great food kept coming in sizable portions and it was all helped down by the unexpected arrival of Spanish digestifs (Pacharan and Orujo de Hierbas). The wine list offers great value - not least in the shape of the marvellous Muge Rioja Gran Riserva that we were told is the favourite tipple of the King (whose palace was visible, beautifully floodlit, just across the road).  Service throughout was friendly and charming. I have never seen crumbs swept from a table with a more theatrical flourish. This was the first night of a short weekend break in Madrid for us, and it succeeded in setting a very high standard for the rest of the holiday. I would certainly recommend La Mi Venta to anyone wanting to eat well-prepared food in a buzzy and authentic ambience - or sitting outside toasting the King in front of The Royal Palace.

title_review: Pricey but the show is amazing!
review_preview: My husband and I enjoyed the Flamenco show very much! We were really impressed. The food is for sure pricey but it's nothing special. (it was 200+ euros for the two of us, show included). The seating isn't the best... it was packed and all...

We were basically eating with the people sitting at the tables on either side of us. Also, the view isn't the best from every side of the restaurant so I'd absolutely suggest that you book a table before you go so that you can get a nice table and really enjoy the show. Overall, it was one of our favorite experiences in Spain.

review_preview: My friend and I ate here our first night in Madrid as it was a very highly rated restaurant around our hotel. What you wouldn't know from the outside is just how amazing the dining experience could be. As soon as we walked in we...
review_full: My friend and I ate here our first night in Madrid as it was a very highly rated restaurant around our hotel. What you wouldn't know from the outside is just how amazing the dining experience could be. As soon as we walked in we saw a platter of Tomatoes and Cured ham on the counter before it was brought out to another customer and already we were salivating. On the table then bring the most high quality olive oil to go with the perfect rustic baked bread. We did order the plate of tomatoes and the cured ham along with the entree of lamb chops which came with potatoes (which were to die for) and peppers and we also got their house red wine which was both affordable and delicious. This unreal meal was accompanied by the most amazing service by A. David, who was so passionate about the product he was serving us. He recommended that we share a dessert of frozen yogurt with mango and passion fruit soup which was actually the most light and delicious end to our meal. Overall this was a first class meal without the outrageous price you usually pay for this level of quality of food and service. If ever in Madrid this place is worth going out of the way for!

review_preview: My partner, Richard whisked me away to Madrid for my 30th birthday! I had done some research beforehand regarding restaurants and I had two in mind. I randomly chose La Mi Venta and I'm so thankful that I did. We got there around 10-1030pm and...
review_full: My partner, Richard whisked me away to Madrid for my 30th birthday! I had done some research beforehand regarding restaurants and I had two in mind. I randomly chose La Mi Venta and I'm so thankful that I did. We got there around 10-1030pm and although we had known that restaurants stay open very late in Madrid, still asked on arrival if they were still serving - which of course they were! We were seated and treated like royalty by our waiter, David. We weren't sure what to order and wanted to try a few things so David made it possible for us by making sure we didn't order to much by halving some of the portions that we ordered and making some fabulous recommendations! We started with a small portion of spanish omelette, which was amazing. I think I had only tried this dish once before and this was totally out of this world! Afterward we were presented with a spectacular plate of jamon iberico, all different sorts and two types of cheeses. David explained all the different types to us and also advised us that we were eating an award winning cheese as well! This was delicious and David was continuously topping up our bread so that we could devour the lot of the exceptionally delicate and delicious jamon! After leisurely eating this plate, we were given our goats cheese salad which David had halved as well due to the portion size being too large for the meal we had intended to eat - the cheese was mouth-watering, the salad extremely fresh and every bite a bit of heaven! As we were keen to have the best culinary experience possible so we had ordered a main to share amongst the two of us of a presa ham, which David had recommended to be the best in Spain. If I hadn't been told it was ham, I would have had no idea - the meat was extremely succulent and perfectly cooked, along side this came grilled small green peppers and thinly sliced potatoes with caramelized onions and red peppers. Fabulous! While finishing our beer and sangria and chit chatting about Madrid, what we wanted to do and relishing over our lovely meal, we ordered a wafer and baked cream cheese dessert (how we had any room left over, I'm not sure but there was no possible way we could have left without having tried a dessert) with fruit coulis which came to us after a good few minutes, giving us a chance to relax and digest with a sweet birthday message and a candle, which I thought was very kind and made the occasion and dinner even more special!  Richard and I both agreed that the food was exceptional but that the service was what made the experience and we will be back to this restaurant the next time we go to Madrid and to be perfectly honest, I can't stop talking about it and the waiter David's service since we got home! I would have no problem recommending this to anyone going to Madrid! By far one of the best meals I have had in my 30 years! Thank you David for making me feel like a queen in a royal city on my birthday! :)

title_review: Excellent service, very good food, nice ambiance
review_preview: This place was a great find.  The servers were fantastic.  David, in particular, was very attentive and took the time to explain things and make good recommendations.  He was clearly very proud of their products (especially the ham and wine) and it was clear that...
review_full: This place was a great find. The servers were fantastic. David, in particular, was very attentive and took the time to explain things and make good recommendations. He was clearly very proud of their products (especially the ham and wine) and it was clear that his goal was to help us having a high quality and memorable dining experience.  The food was quite nice: tomatoes in olive oil and herbs, jamón ibérico, and a bottle of Rioja to start and the Presa and cabra dishes to share as main dishes... all added up to containment. The mango dessert was memorable too, though the coffee left something to be desired. We were surprised that this small, intimate place wasn't busier than it was on a Saturday night (9 to midnight). We got a table without problems without a reservation.

Affordable and clean, good location, simply but nice interior, superb food and great service!

review_preview: Rough-hewn hole-in-the-wall SW of The Prado has some excellent food, friendly service (minimal English) at a very good price.  Many dishes were half (tapas) sized, so we could enjoy more dishes -- very important.The octopus with boiled potato in roasted red pepper sauce was...
review_full: Rough-hewn hole-in-the-wall SW of The Prado has some excellent food, friendly service (minimal English) at a very good price. Many dishes were half (tapas) sized, so we could enjoy more dishes -- very important. The octopus with boiled potato in roasted red pepper sauce was outstanding; I slowly savored every bite. The risotto with boletus mushrooms, dried bacon bits (jamon) and grated cheese was superb; such balanced textures and flavors! The cod and potatoes with boletus sauce was very good. Huevos rotos (sunny side egg on crispy potato slices with bacon) was too oily for me.  Went on a Friday at 5pm, so was quiet and service good.

Heard afterwards that there was a Real Madrid soccer game and bull fight that day in Madrid, but after a week in Madrid I suspect that it was just the normal way to spend a Sunday. The full bars can be quite intimidating for a tourist and we chose a quieter bar where we also had great tapas. The whole street has a great atmosphere and we went there a few times. Agree with some of the other reviewers that it attracts a younger crowd.

review_preview: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, we booked a reservation for our first night in Madrid. We were seated in the least attractive basement room, which was puzzling, but I am pretty sure it is because all the English speakers were clustered with the waiter who can...
review_full: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, we booked a reservation for our first night in Madrid. We were seated in the least attractive basement room, which was puzzling, but I am pretty sure it is because all the English speakers were clustered with the waiter who can speak English. Very charming individual, English not bad, and probably jaded from serving too many tourists. We had the sampler tapas because we did not know what to order. Some excellent items, some not so excellent items. Dumb on our part. Also ordered the gras/pate, which was outstanding, and the grilled squid, which was also exceptional. House wine was okay. They do have a more extensive wine list, but our jet-lagged and addled brains were not ready to split a bottle. While not our top experience, I would recommend it and put more effort into researching what to order.

review_preview: Went here because it was the highest rated restaurant near where we stayed. The waiter as mentioned in other reviews, David, was really exceptional. Enjoyed the wine, some grilled vegetables. He steered toward the presso which was tasty but I think he oversold it. Definitely...
review_full: Went here because it was the highest rated restaurant near where we stayed. The waiter as mentioned in other reviews, David, was really exceptional. Enjoyed the wine, some grilled vegetables. He steered toward the presso which was tasty but I think he oversold it. Definitely a little too fatty for me. I would have left a nice tip, but when the check came, I found they added a charge for a couple of pieces of bread and olive oil that they automatically give you when you are seated(about 4 euros). Also if you want water which of course they offer, they don't tell you or give you an option that they are serving you bottled water. Madrid has perhaps the best city drinking water in Spain, so I would have opted, had I known, for city water. Instead we also got stuck with a few euro charge for the water as well. I can't really complain, because before they give you the check, they comp you a little after dinner liqueur. Do recommend for ambience and service. Food good, not great.

title_review: Fantastic meal and the best service in Madrid
review_preview: We chanced upon this gem of a restaurant whilst on a short city break on the 17th May. The service was second to none, nothing was too much trouble for our waiter, Hosè. An absolute delight of a man. Polite, attentive and with a great...
review_full: We chanced upon this gem of a restaurant whilst on a short city break on the 17th May. The service was second to none, nothing was too much trouble for our waiter, Hosè. An absolute delight of a man. Polite, attentive and with a great knowledge of the food. We had a selection of starters, all of which were excellent and the Sangria was well done. Even though there was six of us in our party and the restaurant was busy, all the food and drink came promptly. The food was very fresh and extremely well prepared. The meats were prepared on a wood fired grill which have if an incredible flavour. Prices were extremely competitive for this calibre of food and it came to about £28 per head all told. I would have no hesitation in recommending this little gem to anyone. Must go!

review_preview: Let me start by saying we loved Corral de la Moreria! The food is very good; the flamenco & music authentic. It was my birthday & the performers surprised me -- sang "Happy Birthday" in English while our waiter brought me a dessert & candle!...
review_full: Let me start by saying we loved Corral de la Moreria! The food is very good; the flamenco & music authentic. It was my birthday & the performers surprised me -- sang "Happy Birthday" in English while our waiter brought me a dessert & candle! So sweet!! My only negative comments are 1) on the expensive side when you consider exchange rate but it does make for a special night, and 2) you sit at long, vertical to the stage rectangular tables so if you're at the end like we were, you are quite far from the stage (vs. dinner-theatre style). It's first to reserve = best seats -- so if you know you're going to Madrid, make your reservation right away!!!!

title_review: They poured their heart and soul on stage.  Simply SPECTACULAR!
review_preview: One of the most intimate hidden gems I've ever stepped into.  The room where dinner is served for the 11 pm show, only has 4 tables, 3 for couples and one for party of 4, very private, cozy and romantic.  The server, Alberto, AMAZING.  Very...
review_full: One of the most intimate hidden gems I've ever stepped into.  The room where dinner is served for the 11 pm show, only has 4 tables, 3 for couples and one for party of 4, very private, cozy and romantic.  The server, Alberto, AMAZING. Very knowledgable of their menu. Very polite, and attentive. After dinner, he asked us how was dinner, and my wife simply said it was a bit undercooked for her taste, immediately he offered another plate.  After dinner we were politely escorted to the next room where performance was going to be. They sat us at an excellent table and Alberto again was very attentive throughout the whole evening. As far as the performance goes, I don't think words could describe it. There were moments that I felt my heart skip a beat, then there were moments I ghasped for air and then there many moments I felt the hair raise all over my body. Not to mention at points I thought smoke is going to rise from their steps. Overall, this is my rating: Decor-5 stars Service-5 stars Food quality-5 star Price of the food-4 (a bit pricy) Price of the show-5 star (worth every penny) The performance-5 star (I wish I could give 10 stars). Especially Abel Harana (a performance out of this world) If you go there, ask for Alberto and tell him the honeymooners from NY recommended him :)

review_preview: I went here after reading the TA reviews and had quite a different experience here than most of the reviewers, which I think is probably largely down to my more quiet and introverted personality, so take heed if you're similar.Taberna Mas Al Sur is...
review_full: I went here after reading the TA reviews and had quite a different experience here than most of the reviewers, which I think is probably largely down to my more quiet and introverted personality, so take heed if you're similar. Taberna Mas Al Sur is quite small, perhaps 6 -- 8 tables, plus a counter at the bar and behind the bar. When we turned up, the tiny space was packed to the rafters with humanity. Despite a booking, on being time, we were told we'd have to wait. That's high up the list of things that Grind My Gears at restaurants. So we ordered cocktails at the bar, standing, and waited for the cows to come home for them to be made. It wasn't like the staff were lazy, they were working their posteriors off! It was just too small a place to handle the number of people in there. The cocktails were, though, pretty good. Perhaps about half an hour to 45 minutes after our booking time, we were offered to share a table with another couple that had also been waiting for a while. Sharing tables after booking is also high on the list of things that Grinds My Gears. So we were seated and ordered. After another while the food came out but they missed a dish for our oder (I think it went to another table that sent it back!!). The food was rich, tasty, and as other reviewers say, generous, so we didn't insist on the missing dish. But of course were were charged for it (but they happily reversed the charges). At another memorable point someone dropped a napkin that had lit on fire. They quickly alerted the staff who asked "would you like another napkin", before the patron pointed out that it really was on fire, on the ground, and the waiter proceeded to do a bit of a latin dance number on it to put it out... all in a day's work around the Mas Al Sur I'd say! So I left with some damaged hearing, a long wait despite booking, shared table, missed dish (but still full stomach), the excitement of the flaming napkin, and a free shot of something Bailey's like at the end. Can't say we'd ever go back, but it was an adventure!

It was a great show, those dancers left everything on the stage! I don't know how they do it several times a night! The guitar performers and singers added to the drama! I went to the 9 pm show. I heard several reviews saying to go to the latest show, but i don't think my experience was muted at all! The whole experience was close to $300 for two people. I had a great time and it was definitely a once in a lifetime experience! Completely worth it in my opinion!

Now the drinks -- a decadent lemonade, wine by the glass that was served as if we were ordering the bottle and mineral water. And finally the food -- The Mediterranean salad was fresh with endives, cheese, lettuce, walnuts, tomatoes and a light dressing. Then, we had risotto with bacon -- delish! A pork dish came with potatoes drenched in what seemed to be a plum sauce. A plate of jamón and what my family described as crackers followed along with the octopus. All of it tasty -- I was stuffed, but my husband and son wanted dessert so they split half portions of carrot cake and red velvet cake. Oh and that awesome waiter -- yeah he brought my son a bowl full of gummies! Somehow all of that food came to €67 -- Spectacular!

Next visit to Madrid we will definitely be re-visiting this place.

review_preview: We went to Corral De La Moreria (CDLM) based on the recommendation from Patricia Schultz in 1000 Places To See Before You Die as well as based on the reviews we read here. But I'm happy to report our experience was even better than we...
review_full: We went to Corral De La Moreria (CDLM) based on the recommendation from Patricia Schultz in 1000 Places To See Before You Die as well as based on the reviews we read here. But I'm happy to report our experience was even better than we expected and a highlight of our trip to Spain. First off, we were expecting something crowded, chaotic, and challenging for a first time visitor to Spain. It was anything but that. This venue is extremely well run and they know how to treat visitors, both locals and foreigners. We arrived early before the restaurant opened at 6pm for our 6:30pm reservation, but were invited in by the manager to sit in the lobby. The lobby is filled with dozens of photographs of famous people who visited CDLM to include Samuel L. Jackson, Mariah Carey, Boris Karloff, Lana Turner, etc. While we were sitting there, the staff came in and conducted a pre-opening business meeting around us and we observed first hand how organized and friendly they are. The staff is young, and they speak English fairly well.  CDLM seats around 100 people and only maybe 3 seats are behind a column which would require you to move a bit (those seats are filled last). Dinner reservations are on the half hour starting at 6:30pm, and it's great to find a Madrid restaurant open that early. The shows are at 8:30pm and 10:20pm, so if you get a 7:00pm or 7:30pm reservation, you'll have no problem getting a good table. The food is excellent, comparable to a high end restaurant. I had steak medallions and my wife had salmon, both were delicious. We had sangria for drinks, probably the best we had in Spain. Total cost for drinks entrees, desserts, and the show ended up being $230 for the two of us, well worth it. The flamenco show lasts for one hour and is spirited, professional, and high quality. At the table they provide the equivalent of a playbill, listing who the performers are and their qualifications. The show consists of four dancers, two guitar players, a percussionist, and three male singers. We were impressed by the show as was everyone there.  CDLM is easy to find, just south of the Royal Place off Calle Bailin and no more than a 10 minute walk from two different metro stations. Their website to make reservations is in English and is easy to understand and use at www.corraldelamoreria.com.

title_review:
A wonderful place to have a Spanish dinner
마드리드에서 완벽한 저녁식사를 원한다면 꼭 가보세요.
review_preview: 구글 리뷰를 보고 좋은 평가가 많아서 찾아간 곳인데 친구들 3명과 정말 만족스러운 식사를 했습니다. 식당 안과 밖에서 식사가 가능한데 저녁엔 날씨가 좋길래 밖을 택했습니다. 식당 뒤로  지는 노을이 너무나도 기억에 남을만큼 아름답습니다. 음식은 빠에야, 하몬, 그리고 스테이크를 먹었습니다. 빠에야를 시키고 저희를 안내해준 Mr. Juan에게 추천받은...
review_full: 구글 리뷰를 보고 좋은 평가가 많아서 찾아간 곳인데 친구들 3명과 정말 만족스러운 식사를 했습니다.  식당 안과 밖에서 식사가 가능한데 저녁엔 날씨가 좋길래 밖을 택했습니다. 식당 뒤로 지는 노을이 너무나도 기억에 남을만큼 아름답습니다.  음식은 빠에야, 하몬, 그리고 스테이크를 먹었습니다. 빠에야를 시키고 저희를 안내해준 Mr. Juan에게 추천받은 스테이크와 하몬을 시켰습니다. 가장 먼저 나온 하몽은 짭짤하면서도 씹을때마다 그 맛이 점점 깊어져 같이 주문한 상그리아와 먹기 매우 적합했습니다. 빠에야는 다양한 해산물이 들어가 있어서 그 풍미가 대단했고, 스테이크는 알맞게 구워 씹을때마다 육즙이 흘러나오는게 환상적입니다. Juan이 온더하우스로 제공해준 꽈리고추와 곁들여 먹으니 그 맛이 잘 어울렸습니다. 식사가 끝나고 다시 한번 식당으로부터 제공받은 꼬냑은 깔끔하게 식사를 마무리 하도록 해주었습니다. 마드리드에서 스페인식 식사를 하며 잊지 못할 기억을 남기고 싶으시다면 꼭 이곳에서 식사해보시길 추천드립니다.  It was a great place to visit and have a satisfying meal with three of my friends.   I can either eat inside and outside the restaurant. I got to see a remarkable sunset as I sat outside.  The food we ordered was Paella, Jamon, and steak. Mr. Juan had recommended steak and Jamon as the house's specialty. Jaemon's flavor gradually grew every time I chewed and it went so perfect with a glass of sangria. Paella comes with a great variety of seafoods, and it was spectacular, and the steaks are cooked just right that its juice come out every time you chew. The side dish and from the house Juan was accompanied by chopped red pepper served to Onder House and it tasted good. Once the meal was over, the cognac, once again served from the restaurant, helped to finish the meal neatly.  If you want to have a Spanish meal in Madrid and you want to make an unforgettable memory, we recommend you to dine here. And thank you Mr. Juan for helping me and my friend have a wonderful first night at Madrid.

title_review: Our first Restaurant in Spain was the Best
review_preview: AS a restaurant, El Corral de la Moreria is an excellent restaurant. You can take your children, no problems they will enjoy the show. Not only the show, but the food was amazing. We order "Secreto Iberico" the chicken, the veal , the 5 chocolates,...
review_full: AS a restaurant, El Corral de la Moreria is an excellent restaurant. You can take your children, no problems they will enjoy the show. Not only the show, but the food was amazing. We order "Secreto Iberico" the chicken, the veal , the 5 chocolates, creme brule, the Goat cheese salad, The Jamon Iberico the Childhood memories, and all, I mean every meal was excellent.. The meal started as soon as we arrive like a quarter to 8 pm then the show started at 9 until 10:15 or so. I am not a person who knows about flamenco, but if it not the best is one of the best. WE all enjoyed. My son (7 years) could not stop watching the show. Reserve in advance online and it is worth to make a phone call to get a table not too far from the show. We went there on Valentine and it was packed but amazingly the service was fast, very polite and they are professionals of the business. When you check the menu online, you will be a ble to see pictures of every meal so you can choose in advance before getting there, it is worth it. You will find the prices high but believe me it is worth it. WE were four and with all and taxes it was 260 in total plus the show which you pay online in advance. DO NOT MISS IT WHEN IN MADRID, believe me you will enjoy as one of the best.

review_preview: When you consider the price of the meal with the flamenco show, this is really a great deal.  Our food was excellent, the service was excellent and the flamenco show was great.This is an historical sight in Madrid.  I saw flamenco here 40 years...
review_full: When you consider the price of the meal with the flamenco show, this is really a great deal. Our food was excellent, the service was excellent and the flamenco show was great. This is an historical sight in Madrid. I saw flamenco here 40 years ago when the great Lucero Tena was still dancing. Little has changed at the restaurant and it is worth the visit today. I would say that the food has gotten better. We usually go with one of the set meals, but you can substitute the salad from one and the entree from another. I had the Goat cheese salad and the steak with the 5 chocolate dessert. Highly recommended. One of our group also had the salmon and was very happy with it. Cost is around 50 Euros each, but the show is included so I think its a great value. It is crowded and intimate, but also very warm and inviting. I would avoid the table right up against the stage, as the dancing can be loud and the swinging dresses knocked over some drinks while we were there last night. All part of the adventure. There were four of us and we were one table off from the stage. Perfect seats and a delightful experience. If you want great food and great flamenco in Madrid, this is the place.

review_preview: Decided to book dinner and the show and were glad that we did.  If you eat dinner in the small adjacent restaurant beforehand, you get a front-row table for the show afterwards. Although this is an expensive outing (tickets for just the show are about...
review_full: Decided to book dinner and the show and were glad that we did. If you eat dinner in the small adjacent restaurant beforehand, you get a front-row table for the show afterwards. Although this is an expensive outing (tickets for just the show are about $50 and the dinner is not cheap -- I seem to recall that this is one of the few places where the VAT was not included in the menu price), it was a memorable experience. The food was also top-notch -- Spanish haute-cuisine and a nice break from the usual tapas. The show was so interesting, it actually led to our visiting a flamenco museum in Cordoba later in the trip.  Tip: Go to the late show if you can. I had read in reviews and also heard from a colleague that the late show is generally more energized and authentic.

review_preview: Very mixed experience for us.  On one hand, the place is great in the terms of experiencing quality flamenco.  True world class performers in a traditional, rustic setting.  HOWEVER, it all depends on where one sits in terms of location and neighbors.  After buying tickets...
review_full: Very mixed experience for us. On one hand, the place is great in the terms of experiencing quality flamenco. True world class performers in a traditional, rustic setting. HOWEVER, it all depends on where one sits in terms of location and neighbors. After buying tickets online several months ahead and traveling all the way from Singapore, we were unlucky enough to be seated in the way back corner, and next to a very, very loud and obnoxious two related family tables. It's really puzzling why they let young children into a place like this. It's even more puzzling how parents just let their kids be in what is suppose to be an intimate setting. They ruined it for us and all the tables around as well. To add insult to injury, the floor staff did nothing about it (in addition to forgetting our simple drink order 3 times!) I picked up the contact of the head staff member and will be lodging a formal complaint.  Bottom Line: May be worth a visit but look around for other options first. Else, pay top dollar but just hope you get a good seat and sit next to polite people. Otherwise, it will feel like a wasted evening.

title_review: A very welcoming restaurant with great food.
review_preview: From the moment we walked in we felt comfortable and welcome. Whenever we had a question about the food or drink it was quickly answered in Spanish and English - with a smile.The extensive menu had a large number of dishes that were 1/2...
review_full: From the moment we walked in we felt comfortable and welcome. Whenever we had a question about the food or drink it was quickly answered in Spanish and English - with a smile. The extensive menu had a large number of dishes that were 1/2 racion - I would recommend them if you want to taste more than one dish. Two of us split 1/2 racions of the salmon with emmentaler cheese, chicken curry and the cuban beef (pulled beef in a mildly spicy sauce). All were very good. The chicken stood out a bit. Our 2 friends got the full racion of the salmon as well as grilled vegetables. We were all stuffed. Beer selection is notable from Belgian to local beer. Wine was good as well. My wife got a gin and tonic with a Galician gin (Nordes) and she felt it was the best gin and tonic she has had. ambience - not loud and very comfortable in terms of feeling welcome. The seats were stools, lighting low. Not modern or a fancy place. Bathroom fine. 55 euros was the total bill for 4 with drinks!

title_review: There's a reasons this is the #1 spanish restaurant in Madrid on Trip Advisor
review_preview: Off the beaten path. Worth the journey there either by foot, metro, or taxi; the plaza del sol is one of the oldest parts of the city and so adds to the flavor of this place. Was not a only a history lesson in Ramón...
review_full: Off the beaten path. Worth the journey there either by foot, metro, or taxi; the plaza del sol is one of the oldest parts of the city and so adds to the flavor of this place. Was not a only a history lesson in Ramón del Valle-Inclán (whom as an American I have never heard of) but an experience in progressive Spanish tapas. I am still bragging about that smoking tuna boat and the beet gazpacho! Easy to book. Welcoming. Charming quirky décor. The waitress was also very attentive to our opinions on the dishes- one of which was comp'ed due to us not preferring it. The cocktails are a neuve take on old classics. Prices are well worth the dishes which were a surprise at every arrival. Take your appetite and get 6-8 tapas for a party of 2... your taste buds and eyes will thank you later!

review_preview: After some fine tapas including excellent jamon ibérico yesterday, today we went back for the cabrito asado (a roasted quarter of a goat). The chef said he'd be putting it into the into the charcoal-fired clay oven about 1pm and be primo for eating about...
review_full: After some fine tapas including excellent jamon ibérico yesterday, today we went back for the cabrito asado (a roasted quarter of a goat). The chef said he'd be putting it into the into the charcoal-fired clay oven about 1pm and be primo for eating about 3:30pm. It was superb--tender, moist and succulent, and with other pieces nice and crispy. Preceded by an impressive mixed green salad and accompanied by the more expensive (14.5 euros) of their two rosados (rosés), it was a lunch to write home about...or to TripAdvisor at any event. Perfect, friendly service both visits, and the other menu selections may bring us back a third time before we leave Madrid.

review_preview: We enjoy roasted goat so went to La Mi Venta. Our late lunch was beyond our expectations. The service is extremely friendly and helpful. We had selected tapas to start our meal and they served a wonderful variety.  Cured meats, cheeses, escargot, tripe among others...
review_full: We enjoy roasted goat so went to La Mi Venta. Our late lunch was beyond our expectations. The service is extremely friendly and helpful. We had selected tapas to start our meal and they served a wonderful variety. Cured meats, cheeses, escargot, tripe among others were extremely tasty and fun to try. The roasted goat was superb, tender, juicy with crispy skin. It was served with a plate of potatoes, red peppers, onions and peppers all beautifully presented. This dish was so colorful and flavorful. We were seated in the lower level in a room with great character. Brick walls, lovely linens and roomy tables. We took their recommendation for wine and it was terrific with the goat. We will be talking about this meal for years!! Devine.

title_review: Good local place near the train station and art museum
review_preview: During a recent visit to Madrid, we asked the hotel for a suggestion for dinner.  This is where they went us.  They marked it on the map.The restaurant is a few blocks from the train stations, basically behind the art museum.It’s a narrow,...
review_full: During a recent visit to Madrid, we asked the hotel for a suggestion for dinner. This is where they went us. They marked it on the map. The restaurant is a few blocks from the train stations, basically behind the art museum. It’s a narrow, yet deep restaurant. It looks like it’s a local place. The décor was rustic, although we saw some recognizable Ikea furniture. The place got packed quickly. Lots of folks like us, maps in hand, came in. We were seated up front near the bar. There’s a high energy level. We had risotto, which was good. We also had a bottle of wine and a bottle of water. The bill came to about 34 Euros, which wasn’t bad. Service was good. Are there negatives? It’s hard to find. It didn’t appear that the house numbers worked the same way they do back home. I thought we were lost, then we found it.

review_preview: This is a nice, a bit more upscale place with some very delicious unique dishes without the exorbitant prices.The paella was the best of 4 paella so we had in the week in Spain. I would have easily rated this place a 5 star...
review_full: This is a nice, a bit more upscale place with some very delicious unique dishes without the exorbitant prices. The paella was the best of 4 paella so we had in the week in Spain. I would have easily rated this place a 5 star if not for that 8 out of 10 clams in the paella was not opened and hence by my understanding not cooked. But the waiter tried to explain it away by saying that the clams opened during cooking, the flavors extracted and they closed tight again once removed from stove. I think this was an unnecessary silly cop out as we enjoyed the dish nevertheless. He could have taken cared of that it other ways and we would have been happy. I took one star off for that. The pintos were delicious although be careful if you order that the portion is large and can easily fill you before your main course.  We had thought they had suckling pig on their menu but they don't. Instead We ordered their roasted goatling , supposed slow roasted in a traditional way. Our teenagers with discriminating palate loved it. My wife on the other hand did not like the "gamey" taste of the goat meat which was not covered by the very subtle flavor. The meat was very soft from the slow roasting. We sat in the basement that used to be used to hang hams to be cured. It was charming, quiet and so cooling from the summer heatwave.  The service and waiters were otherwise impeccable. The price is not for the budget conscious but reasonable for a nice , charming, comfortable restaurant.

title_review: A place deserving of its great reviews
review_preview: We found this place based on the impressive reviews on TripAdvisor.  Our experience confirmed what people said in the reviews. Not only was the food great, but the service was awesome. In particular, the manager Cristian noticed one of the dishes was not finished after...
review_full: We found this place based on the impressive reviews on TripAdvisor. Our experience confirmed what people said in the reviews. Not only was the food great, but the service was awesome. In particular, the manager Cristian noticed one of the dishes was not finished after sitting on the table for a while. He came and asked us whether the dish was not to our liking. He insisted on taking the fish off of our check since we were not 100% satisfied, and came around while we got the check to ensure it was indeed taken off. Thank you, Cristian. Each tapas dish was wonderful and also plentiful - this is not a tapas where you go home hungry! Our waiter was polite and gave intricate details on each plate. title_review: Best Flamenco Dance Dinner Show in Madrid
review_preview: I am surprised that this very popular restaurant did not come up as a suggested restaurant to review on Trip Advisor.  During our stay in Madrid we all wanted to see a traditional Flamenco Dance Show.  Everybody we spoke to said that the "Corral de...
review_full: I am surprised that this very popular restaurant did not come up as a suggested restaurant to review on Trip Advisor. During our stay in Madrid we all wanted to see a traditional Flamenco Dance Show. Everybody we spoke to said that the "Corral de la Moreria" had the best show. The food was also excellent which surprised us. Two of us (including myself) had Monk Fish for our main course, and we really enjoyed this amazing and tender fish. Our only complaint for the evening is that the courses are on the small side, and we had to eat most of our meal in the dark as the lights are turned off during the show. The Flamenco show was amazing and I highly recommend that you go see the show. For a complete meal with appetizers, drinks, and dessert, just be ready to shell out about $125.00 per person. The show is a separate charge which is added to your final bill.

My husband, myself, and our 2yr old son were immediately greeted and seated at a table. We perused the menu and ordered the risotto with ham, noddles with veggies, and the Mediterranean salad. We ordered half sizes for the dishes as we planned to share. We also ordered a glass of house red and a glass of sangria. Y’all..this was the BEST sangria we’ve ever had! We’ve been to Spain multiple times and haven’t had sangria as good as Mas al Sur! They use orange juice and cinnamon(FYI). DELICIOUS! We also had a piece of passion fruit cheesecake and what a surprise. DELICIOUS again. Our waiter was very interactive with our son and very friendly. They all spoke English, but my husband speaks Spanish so we didn’t have a problem ordering. We had great service and great food! Note to families: no changing table, but they do have high chairs. Groups, reservations, and walk-ins welcome!

review_preview: My girlfriend and I went here shortly after arriving in Madrid. We unfortunately didn’t have a great experience. Food: We ordered a Caesar salad, and half order of the prawns, risotto, stewed pork, and chicken curry. The Caesar, risotto, and prawns all came within minutes...
review_full: My girlfriend and I went here shortly after arriving in Madrid. We unfortunately didn’t have a great experience.  Food: We ordered a Caesar salad, and half order of the prawns, risotto, stewed pork, and chicken curry. The Caesar, risotto, and prawns all came within minutes of each other, which was a little strange but it was fine. However the stewed pork and curry took a while which kind of took away from our dining experience. The Caesar was not bad, however the croutons were stale. The stewed pork, prawns, and risotto were all fine, while the chicken curry was rather plain.  Service: All of our servers were adequate/nice, but I’ve never felt more disrespected by our host/waiter. When we arrived st the restaurant, we walked in and he immediately halted us and told us to wait. No greeting, just a “HOLD ON.” Several minutes go by and he leads us to our table, and leaves the menus at the table before we have a chance to sit down.  When taking our order, he rushed us through our order, didn’t repeat when there was clearly a language barrier, and didn’t offer to clarify. He didn’t mess up our order, but we did have to repeat it several times because he seemed distracted.  The most disturbing part of our experience is the lack of attention we saw from him; and moreso the gross (literally) treatment of other patrons that were females. A nearby couple had the male go to the restroom, and our waiter immediately went up to talk to the young woman sitting by herself, obviously flirting with her and shaking her hand and getting far too close than any waiter ever should. We took it as a language barrier because they were speaking in Spanish, while we only spoke English.  Another table of three women he continually serviced and flirted with, was playful with, and very chatty with. Again three Spanish speakers, so we thought nothing of it.  As we were finishing up our meal, three other women come in who were also English speakers sat near us, and the male waiter once again seemed predatory in his approach to these women. Asking where are they from, being very playful and flirtatious. It was very disturbing to see this waiter be so flirtatious with women by themselves. This same waiter did not say anything to us our entire meal other than taking our order. Another more normal looking couple came in after us and received the same treatment we got; negligence.  Not talking to us because you’re busy is fine, but being an absolute creep, preying on other women is disgusting. It tainted our entire experience at this place, and honestly cannot recommend this place because of moreso how gross this waiter was. I don’t wish this kind of treatment on anyone.

review_full: My wife and I booked a table on the strength of trip advisor reviews and were glad we did. The place is very modern and well presented with good background music. We arrived for our 9pm booking and were immediately shown our table. It was very busy, so booking is recommended. It took a little too long to be given menus and served drinks, but the food more than made up for that. Our waiter gave good advice about the food and recommended the number of dishes we would need. When the food came, it was simply delicious. Well presented and very well cooked. There is enough choice on the menu to suit most people. The prices are a bit more than normal, but the food is worth paying the extra. Some people might find the place and people a bit pretentious, but we liked it and will return if we ever go back to Madrid.

review_preview: We loved the flamenco show!!  We originally wanted to do just the show and a drink, but it was sold out for that option and we had to have dinner there to watch the show.  I had read that the food wasn't great at the...
review_full: We loved the flamenco show!! We originally wanted to do just the show and a drink, but it was sold out for that option and we had to have dinner there to watch the show. I had read that the food wasn't great at the tableaus, so I was hesitant to book the dinner. We ended up doing it, and it turned out pretty well in the end. The show made it all worthwhile. On the downside, it is very expensive. They give you the option for a al carte or a prix faire menu. We tried to order the meals on the fixed price menu but they were out of two of the options we wanted (chicken and a veal dish). This was surprising since we were at the first seating for the show. They did allow us to substitute steak in for the the missing meals, and they turned out to be fine. However, our waiter was either new, or didn't understand english well, because he didn't know what we ordered and we had to repeat ourselves several times and point to the menu items to place our orders. Forget clarifying anything on the menu with him! Additionally, he brought our meals out late, and brought us food we didn't order on three of our meals. We couldn't identify what it was they brought us, and the show had started so it was not possible to really discuss it with him. It wouldn't have helped anyway. The good news is that we really liked whatever food they did give us.  I will say, that while the service and the mistakes were disappointing given the price we were paying, in the end it turned out fine. The show was wonderful and we really enjoyed it. It was truly unlike anything I had ever seen before and I am so glad we went.

review_preview: I attended a Dinner with Flamenco show at Corral de la Moreria on 31st March 2015.  When we arrived we saw the tables are arranged very close to each other to the extent that it's difficult to even move the chair little bit to sit....
review_full: I attended a Dinner with Flamenco show at Corral de la Moreria on 31st March 2015. When we arrived we saw the tables are arranged very close to each other to the extent that it's difficult to even move the chair little bit to sit. Even the waiters seem to have difficulty moving around and serving. I found the dishes not so tasty and highly overpriced. A three course meal for 2 persons costed 140 Euro, whereas we ate a very delicious 3 course lunch same day at Thyssen Bornemisza museum café for 30 Euros. Now, coming to the Flamenco show. The Gitarists looked uninterested in the show and looked bored. One solo lady singer who sang some song was screaming so loud, it was difficult to tolerate her song and voice. The male and female dancers were good at the foot work and had lot of enthusiasm and interest. Overall, I think it is beneficial to avoid this place as one can neither enjoy the food nor the dance. It's very very overpriced. The total expenditure for dinner and dance show was approx 250 Euro. So, go if you don't mind spending money.

review_preview: The thing about a much talked-of place is that expectations are so high. It is so easy to go downhill from there on.The wait outside Corral de la Moreira for the 22:20 show was a bit long. Fortunately, there were few interesting people to...
review_full: The thing about a much talked-of place is that expectations are so high. It is so easy to go downhill from there on. The wait outside Corral de la Moreira for the 22:20 show was a bit long. Fortunately, there were few interesting people to chat up with while waiting. The service – this impressed me the most, and by this, I am referring to the waiters. The restaurant was full; with every person on every table asking for different varieties of dishes. They managed to deliver the right food to the right person, all promptly and with a pleasant service. The food – I have mixed feeling about it. I enjoyed the starter and salads but my main dish (sea bass in cream) didn't feel fresh. It was lukewarm, and not hot. It tasted strange. Another person in our group ordered the same dish and felt the same too. The dance – I was curious how they would dance about as the stage was pretty small (compared to Café de Chinitas, for example). But, this is where the magic began. The performers were good. They live in their dance. Their expressions and their passion made the show so thrilling. I particularly liked “El Junco”. He is so talented. The price of the show was reasonable, given that they are top class performers. The food was a bit over-priced.  I liked the experience but I am not particularly blown away.

title_review: Great Show, Good Food, Big Price
review_preview: Our hotel recommended this flamenco show as the had the best show and best dinner options. I have to say the show and cuisine were delicious. Our server Juan Pablo was friendly, attentive and fun. My wine glass was never empty and there was always...
review_full: Our hotel recommended this flamenco show as the had the best show and best dinner options. I have to say the show and cuisine were delicious. Our server Juan Pablo was friendly, attentive and fun. My wine glass was never empty and there was always a smile while serving. I will caveat saying that dinner and show is quite expensive. It's almost 40 Euros just for entry and that doesn't include the meal. The entrees run about 25-30 Euros. Save room for the Vanilla Crème Brûlée, a yummy interesting take on the famous dessert. The show was amazing. So much talent and passion. Enjoyed it immensely.  So in all, kind of expensive, but worth it for a once in a lifetime trip to Madrid

review_full: When I go any good show, foods usually disappoints me. We preferred this place for its well known Flemenco show. But when we start tasting the foods we really impressed. We tried warm Goat's Cheese Salad with mixed green leaves, Sweet Wine Sauce and a Crunchy Topping &Rack of Pré-Salé Lamb with Pumkin Puree and Rustic Potatoes together with wery good red wine. We really enjoyed the well cooked food. The show also was very good. The ambiance is good, waiters are helpful, nice and smiley. The waiter was not only good, he was really passionate! I can quote him saying: "If you really want the rice, I can give you the rice, but that's not what we are known for. Other places make better rice, but we are amongst the best in terms of meat.". And that's when we decided that we will eat Paella another day. We had a patanegra pork steak with a ratatouille as side dish and it was incredible. Also, they made sure that our wine glasses were never empty and that we are always served with hot bread and fresh olive oil.  If I ever visit Madrid again, La mi Venta is a must.

title_review: Amazing tapas bar with a young and innovative vibe
review_preview: My husband and I went to this tapas bar for dinner. The service is quick, however if I were to critique anything I would say that the wait staff can appear to be preoccupied and rushed at times, hardly waiting for you to finish your...
review_full: My husband and I went to this tapas bar for dinner. The service is quick, however if I were to critique anything I would say that the wait staff can appear to be preoccupied and rushed at times, hardly waiting for you to finish your order before scurrying off to the next table. Though for the most part this proved to be advantageous as the food service matched this speed. The menu is very impressve with the mushroom risotto, gazpacho, and hot dog with sauerkraut as the big stand outs. Priced reasonably with us paying €40 for 2 of us which included a jug of sangria and 5 tapas which were all delicious.  The restaurant itself has an amazingly eccentric fit out and very quirky features, like a hot dog served in a dog bowl. Very unique.  Strong recommendation for this if you’re a tapas fan.

review_preview: I could not find one fault with this restaurant!From the moment you arrive the service is a delight, being seated in the restaurant area you specify, we selected the cave. the menu covers various tapas specialities, cold meat and cheese platters and house specials....
review_full: I could not find one fault with this restaurant! From the moment you arrive the service is a delight, being seated in the restaurant area you specify, we selected the cave. the menu covers various tapas specialities, cold meat and cheese platters and house specials. The stars of the menu are the charcoal grilled meats, roast lamb, beef steak and Iberico pork. Our party of four selected starters to share,cold meat platter, which were top qualit ham and various salami.Main courses were iberian pressa, which was grilled to perfection, octopus and a foie burger which was not your normal tourist fare. All the food was well presented and cooked to perfection. Wine list was excellent and very reasonable,€17 for a great Spanish rose. Desserts are not to be missed, home made and unusual. Complementary drink at end of meal. The service was great throughout the meal, nothing was too much trouble, all explanations of the menu added to the experience. The cost for four, shared starters, bread, water, four exceptional mains, desserts, coffee, two bottles of wine €160, great value for a great experience. This will be our go to restaurant in Madrid in the future. FAULTLESS

We finished off with the Nutella cheesecake, and I honestly teared up on the first bite. Afterwards we relaxed and chatted with a cafe con leche, and the Morning Team brought us complimentary Crema De Roho, a crème liqueur made in Northern Spain.  Everything was beyond fantastic, and so, so fresh. A special and exceptional meal, experience, and memory. We are so grateful!  XOXO, Madeleine, Jibran, Emma, and Felix

Would definitely recommend this restaurant, take a big appetite!

A side dish, an insect went into my glass of wine and the waiter complimentary me with another white which was a bit more sour but more aromatic with essence of flower. Great to go with hake.

review_preview: If my reviews of Madrid restaurants are starting to sound a bit repetitious it's only because they really were all very good & this restaurant was no exception.   For a start, it's easy to find - just a up a side street around 100 metres...
review_full: If my reviews of Madrid restaurants are starting to sound a bit repetitious it's only because they really were all very good & this restaurant was no exception. For a start, it's easy to find - just a up a side street around 100 metres from the front of the Royal Palace, or alternatively 5 minutes walk from Opera metro station. After sifting through Trip Advisor's restaurant reviews prior to our Madrid trip this place made it to our shortlist on the strength of good reviews but the fact that it also had some outside tables was an added attraction for us. They don't take reservations for the outside tables but when we arrived (around 8 pm - very early by Madrid standards) there was still plenty of room outside. We didn't get to see the inside (although I gather from other reviewers it's good) but sitting outside was very nice & I had a view of part of the palace over my dinner companion's shoulder. It made an attractive backdrop, particularly after it started to get dark & the palace lights came on. Our waiter was very pleasant & spoke good english which made life easier when it came to ordering. I went for pork, my friend opted for the steak & while we were waiting for it to be prepared, our waiter brought us bread, olives & some quality olive oil for dipping. For wine we shared a bottle of house red (a safe option in Madrid). All were excellent. This restaurant has a lot going for it - it's well located, food, wine & service are all very good & the prices are extremely reasonable. I recommend it.

title_review: Outstanding cuisine and exceelent TRUE Flamenco!
review_preview: This was probably the best meal during our entire stay in Spain. The chef was trained at Il Bulli and it shows. The food was outstanding especially the tasting menu of excellent seared scallops, sea bass,  delicious  tiny lamb chops and a 6 chocolate desert!...
review_full: This was probably the best meal during our entire stay in Spain. The chef was trained at Il Bulli and it shows. The food was outstanding especially the tasting menu of excellent seared scallops, sea bass, delicious tiny lamb chops and a 6 chocolate desert! There is a tiny refiend VIP dining room you should request. it hold 5-6 tables. Otherwise you sit in a very large open room sometimes with other guests.The restaurant is really an excellent flamenco show owned by the retired superstar Flamenco dancer Carmen Del Rey. She is charming and gracious, she sat next to us at dinner in private room and show. She is also the MC of the show [although solely in Spanish!!]. This is true, real Flamenco with world class dancers. DO NOT MISS Corral De La Moreira!

My only criticism, however, is that the dishes have arrived lukewarm on occasion (but the flavour is still great). Another plus is the staff - they are extremely welcoming and friendly, which just helps to make the experience even more enjoyable. This is a great place to bring friends, celebrate birthdays or even just pop in for a drink!

review_preview: If you're looking for a place where to have a break from your cultural trip in madrid you should definitely stop here. This place is just 5m away from the museum area and it definitely worth it to hold on the cultural activities and give...
review_full: If you're looking for a place where to have a break from your cultural trip in madrid you should definitely stop here. This place is just 5m away from the museum area and it definitely worth it to hold on the cultural activities and give it a go!  The place has some outside seats and if the day offers some sunshine and warm weather (which is not rare in madrid) you can consume your meal outside and get the best out of this sensorial experience!  We had a bottle of wine to accompany the amazing food, vino blanco which goes along pretty well with fish. The grilled octopus with potatoes was fabulous, same for the risotto mushrooms and ham on top. A dish of prawns to conclude the lunch with dignity is mandatory. Tips: order half portion to stick with the spanish manner (tapas). Ultimately you can share the dish and get to try everything!!  The final bill was surprising as well, 35euro to fill you up in the best way ever!  Highly recommended!!

title_review: Exceeded Expectations - Good Food, Good Show, Go Early and Prepared to pay NYC prices
review_preview: We enjoyed the show, and the food actually was quite good.  I didn't believe the reviews, but my family agreed it was one of the best meals we had in Spain.  The waiter was very helpful and suggested a great wine.  If you want to...
review_full: We enjoyed the show, and the food actually was quite good. I didn't believe the reviews, but my family agreed it was one of the best meals we had in Spain. The waiter was very helpful and suggested a great wine.  If you want to maximize the experience, book ahead and get there early. We were the first ones there and they gave us an unobstructed table right in front. Saw some people coming in later who threw a fit at being seated in the back behind a column of pillars.  Also in terms of price, I'd compare it to a semi-fancy NYC restaurant and then going to see a full price Broadway show afterwards, maybe with parking and babysitting on top. But the show was worth it.  Also you'll see all the celebrity photo's of people who've been there, and its definitely on the list of places to go. It's full of tourist but fun.  We went to a much more low key and cheaper Flamenco in Seville two nights later, and some of us liked this performance better.  Also take a picture of your group against the lit up Cathedral in the park across the street from the restaurant. One of our best photos.

title_review: Amazing food and service - Alejandro, Nico & Roberto rock!
review_preview: My family of four walked in without a reservation at around 1:30 on a Wednesday. It was getting busy but we were seated immediately anyway. From the time we sat down, we were treated very warmly and given outstanding service...Alejandro, Roberto and Nico took great...
review_full: My family of four walked in without a reservation at around 1:30 on a Wednesday. It was getting busy but we were seated immediately anyway. From the time we sat down, we were treated very warmly and given outstanding service...Alejandro, Roberto and Nico took great care of us! They were very kind to our two teenagers as well, making sure everyone enjoyed what they ordered. Alejandro chatted with us for a time, and let us know about their sister restaurant, Rosi La Loca, which we immediately made a reservation for the following evening! Three of us ordered the menu of the day, consisting of a starter, entree and dessert (for 12.90 euros at lunch!), and my husband ordered tapas. Everything was excellent, but the taste and presentation of the tuna tataki was the absolute show-stopper! It arrived in a "boat" with smoke coming from underneath. Almost too pretty to eat! Almost. Cannot recommend this restaurant enough. Food and service truly incomparable!

They put a box with a little jar on the table, my friend got her veal and I kept waiting for my plate, but the jar was my course, appearantly. The menu didn't make notice of foie gras so I didn't expect it, was a letdown for me. Luckily the dessert (crusted chocolate with violet ice cream) more than made up for it, was a little piece of heaven. We closed the evening with a mini cocktail (great that you can choose a little cocktail for really affordable price). The staff is very nice and friendly, even though they have to jump from table to table. I would recommend reservation for a good place to sit (our place was close to toilets but as we did not make a reservation I was glad to be seated).

title_review: A must for Madrid visitors and locals!
review_preview: I have been living in Madrid for almost two years and Más al Sur easily takes the cake for my favorite restaurant in the city. The food is always phenomenal. (I particularly love their menú del día offerings on weekdays for only 9.90€!) The sangría...
review_full: I have been living in Madrid for almost two years and Más al Sur easily takes the cake for my favorite restaurant in the city. The food is always phenomenal. (I particularly love their menú del día offerings on weekdays for only 9.90€!) The sangría is spectacular - best in Madrid (trust me, I've tried a LOT of sangria!!). Whenever I have guests I always take them here and it never disappoints. Not to mention the service is exceptional. Johnny, the owner, makes everyone feel welcome and special. The bartenders, especially Yosemel, make each and every drink as if it were a work of art! I absolutely love Más al Sur, I can't say it enough! Whether you live in Madrid or are here for a visit, make time for this restaurant. I promise you won't regret it!

title_review: Very good--but Taberna Al Sur is even better
review_preview: We went here for dinner the day after visiting Taberna Al Sur, Mas Al Sur's cousin. Mas Al Sur is a very good restaurant and the food is as good as we had anywhere. That said, it suffered slightly by comparison with its cousin. The...
review_full: We went here for dinner the day after visiting Taberna Al Sur, Mas Al Sur's cousin. Mas Al Sur is a very good restaurant and the food is as good as we had anywhere. That said, it suffered slightly by comparison with its cousin. The tapas menu wasn't as extensive and the items that were the same were better at Al Sur. That said, the croquetas were quite delicious, as was the beet cake we had for dessert (sort of like a red velvet cake). The moussaka was good, but not quite as good. The ropa vieja wasn't really my thing, and it's a Cuban dish in any event. Service was excellent--our server was very attentive and helpful--and again, if you're in the area this is a top-notch, inexpensive choice. We just found Al Sur to be the better of the two.

title_review: Excellent food with good variety and really nice staff
review_preview: We normally try many different restaurants, but La Mi Venta was so good, authentic and reasonably priced that we went twice in three days: once for lunch and once for tapas/dinner. For lunch, we had the platter of hams and dried meats to experience those...
review_full: We normally try many different restaurants, but La Mi Venta was so good, authentic and reasonably priced that we went twice in three days: once for lunch and once for tapas/dinner. For lunch, we had the platter of hams and dried meats to experience those local specialties and then shared the lamb chops (thinly sliced and cooked over a wood parilla). It was all good, but the surprise was the potato side dish with the lamb (how did they get so much wine flavor in the dish?) For tapas/dinner, we had the platter of traditional cooked tapas and really enjoyed those, even the tripe. Along with one pincho (the liver and apple) and wine, it was plenty for dinner for two. The lunch was about $70 including tax and tip (though we left extra) and the tapas/dinner was only $35.

We visited on Thursday, February 4th 2016 with 4 friends. We had lunch in the basement that once was used to dry the famous iberico jamon. The dishes are not satisfactory quantity wise, they are huge. The quality, the way they were cooked without exaggerations, was close to perfection. It is not cheap but it is not expensive for what they offer. Don't forget to try the amazing deserts. The "sopa" soup is simple amazing. I will definitely go again one day.

We got there early by Madrid standards, well before 9, but capacity is limited and if you want a table at peak period, especially outdoors, you're better advised to reserve. Our waiter Johnny is a local and was the most kind and attentive waiter I have experienced in my 3 weeks here in Madrid. He alone is worth the trip as he works here every day.  It was only a five minute walk from our Airbnb which was very nice to start off with. Upon arrival we were immediately greeted and taken care. We decided to sit outside because it was a nice night and I couldn't have been happier about the choice. Now for the food. We skipped right over the appetizers and went straight into the meals. 100% recommend ordering a bunch of the half plates. We started off the risotto which was phenomenal. Next we had the ropa views which with the chips was delicious, I'd recommend trying it with the warm bread that they give you. We finished off with the garlic prawns and the solomillo+Sur. The sauce for the garlic prawns was to die for as dipping sauce for you bread.  10/10 recommend for anyone visiting.
