title_review: So good we went back a second time...
review_preview: We ate here on our second-to-last night in Madrid, and liked it so much we went back for our last night's meal as well.  Staff was friendly, efficient, informative re menu, wine recommendations, etc.  The brother/owners were welcoming and helpful with reservations, and pretty much...
review_full: We ate here on our second-to-last night in Madrid, and liked it so much we went back for our last night's meal as well. Staff was friendly, efficient, informative re menu, wine recommendations, etc. The brother/owners were welcoming and helpful with reservations, and pretty much everyone's English was better than our Spanish. Both meals were excellent. For starters we had tapas on both nights, the first the "Iberian Combination" which includes the restaurant's own ham, which is really pretty spectacular. The second night we tried the Traditional tapas, which included among other items a delicious bit of omelette, and the restaurant's own chorizo. The main courses we tried were also fine: cod loin tempura-style, lamb chops, and on our second visit T-bone for two. (BTW, and although based on admittedly limited samples, in Madrid it seems "medium rare" means no-kidding-rare -- OK with us, but bear it in mind when ordering.) We shared a bottle of Sierra Cantabria tempranillo on both nights, excellent and well priced. We ate upstairs, at one of four 'high chair' tables in the back of the restaurant, a pleasant and intimate brick walled space. There's a pretty cool antique vaulted space downstairs, which we would have tried, but was booked. The restaurant was fully booked both nights, and we couldn't get in later than 8p, early for Madrid. Well worth it, however, and we really enjoyed this place. We were encouraged that, although right across from the Royal Palace, and providing English menus and website access, the restaurant seemed to be mostly patronized by Madrideños rather than out of towners. Nothing against us tourists! But Madrid is by all accounts a food-loving and -knowledgeable city, and we thought this spoke well for the quality of food, wine, value, and service at La Mi Venta. All in all a fun/easy/great place to eat.

review_preview: We  stopped for lunch after a visit to the Reina Sofia and were very, very happy to have done so. The food (both of us Menu del Dia choices @ €9,50 for wine, starter, main and coffee) was really quite good. Interesting choices, served with...
review_full: We stopped for lunch after a visit to the Reina Sofia and were very, very happy to have done so.  The food (both of us Menu del Dia choices @ €9,50 for wine, starter, main and coffee) was really quite good. Interesting choices, served with warmth and grace by very nice young men, though in an unprepossessing location.  The sidewalk tables make this mostly a sunny day choice, probably. (We did not look inside.) and great for people watching and soaking up Madrid at a place frequented primarily by Spanish speakers.  Don't expect a menu in any language other than Spanish or to be served in any language other than Spanish. Do not, however, be afraid to give your Spanish its best go, nor to be adventurous in your choice. (A Wordreference app on your cell wouldn't hurt.) I ended up with thinly sliced eel in scrambled eggs for my starter and ate it all. Never had eel before; Never wanted it; Never thought to want it. But was it good here? Definitely yes. Would I have it again? Maybe.  Our mains (properly cooked cod over sliced potatoes in an indescribably good cooking sauce for me and thinly sliced or beaten veal with potato and peppers for my wife) were equally good and high quality fare. My wife raved about the tastes of what she had before her. I was too busy enjoying mine to try hers.  All this to say that I am very pleased to be able to recommend this restaurant highly.  It is not 'fine dining', but it is excellent fare, well prepared, well served and, certainly, good value for money.

title_review: Great food and good service atvery reasonable price

review_full: We went to this place after reading the reviews here. It has certainly lived up to our high expectations. We ordered grilled squid salad, curry chicken and shredded beef. All of them are so delicious! And a glass of very good wine is only 2.70 Euro. The price is about 20-30% less than those in a tourist area a few miles away. Nelson is the waiter who served us. He is very friendly and welcoming and speaks fluent English. We had a really nice chitchat, which doesn't normally happen in other restaurants in Madrid. Highly recommended!

Mas al Sur's proximity, it's TripAdvisor rating and the presence of Pulpo a la Plancha on its menu made this the destination of choice! We were cheerfully greeted and seated with menus in English (do I have an invisible tattoo somewhere?), plied with drinks and ordered. The menu del dia looked good value at €9.90, but I was locked in on octopus. It was wonderful - a full tentacle in a mildly warm highly reduced garlic and onion sauce - more of a paste - with boiled potatoes to provide textural contrast and a mop for the paste/sauce. Everyone else could have had burnt toast for all I cared, although the didn't, I hasten to add!

review_preview: Dropped by after visiting the Reina Sofia for an early (7pm) dinner.Our waiter Dima was attentive and brought us olives after serving us our bottle of wine. We ordered the Paella de Marisco and the Bacalao con queso (salt cod and potatoes with cheese...
review_full: Dropped by after visiting the Reina Sofia for an early (7pm) dinner. Our waiter Dima was attentive and brought us olives after serving us our bottle of wine. We ordered the Paella de Marisco and the Bacalao con queso (salt cod and potatoes with cheese drizzled w honey). Both dishes were tasty and good sized portions. My wife loved her fish dish! Dima then presented us with the house made cheesecake. It was better than any other cheesecake I've ever had.(NY cheesecake didnt compare). It was all followed up by some Baileys Irish creme type of aperitif. Our total bill came to less than 43 euros! In Madrid, are you kidding me! What a meal and deal. My wife said it was the best dinner we had during our stay in Madrid. We've been here for 5 days already. Dima was awesome. He was attentive but not overbearing. The food was tasty and we walked out stuffed and happy. The ambience was perfect and not too noisy but just right! We will definitely come back on our next trip to Madrid.

review_preview: We loved this place. The staff were so friendly and welcoming - particularly Alex and Carla. The owner has chosen his staff well - they make a great team and their friendliness made all the difference to the eating out experience. We don't speak much...
review_full: We loved this place. The staff were so friendly and welcoming - particularly Alex and Carla. The owner has chosen his staff well - they make a great team and their friendliness made all the difference to the eating out experience. We don't speak much Spanish (a great understatement) and they really took the time to go through the menu and explain (in English) all the dishes - nothing was too much trouble. We'd enjoyed it so much we went back again. The food was excellent - as per other reviewers we had the Ropa vieja (which is a bit like pulled beef with fried potatoes - divine) and the Solomillo - pork tenderloin in a wonderful rich wine sauce - out of this world - and the Lomo al Oporto, which is a creamy pork dish with cheese and served with rice (less exciting/blander but very nice). We felt it was very good value given the food quality and service - Between us (2 people) we had 4 beers and 1 bottle Rioja, 1 tapa, 3 main courses (raciones), 1 tiramasu, and 1 coffee all for 63.65 euros. We can highly recommend it if you're looking for a fun place with good food and lively, busy atmosphere.

review_full: We drank a delicious red wine from the Catalan region for lunch from Montsant called Brunus. At 20E a bottle, it was as least as good as wines I've had in NYC costing five times as much. The grilled lamb chops could have been leaner, but jamon and eggs over french fries were a delicious luncheon treat. Pleasing mousse for dessert. We ate upstairs in the bar area--quiet, comfortable, romantic--and will happily return some day to try the dining room downstairs. Around the corner from the Opera and Palace, the location is good. Meal with tip about 65 Euros.

title_review: Out of the way and out of this world
review_preview: La Mi Venta is located on a Madrid side street, near Plaza Oriente and Jardines de Sabatini. We went on the recommendation of our hotel concierge and we enjoyed to one of our finest meals during our visit to Spain. La Mi Venta is an...
review_full: La Mi Venta is located on a Madrid side street, near Plaza Oriente and Jardines de Sabatini. We went on the recommendation of our hotel concierge and we enjoyed to one of our finest meals during our visit to Spain. La Mi Venta is an intimate restaurant, but comfortable. There are sidewalk tables, a first floor dining area and an elegant downstairs dining area where our party of four was seated. On a scorching hot evening, it was cool, calm and nicely lit -- like a renovated wine cellar. The wait staff have worked in Europe and the US, so they offered experience and spoke confidently in many languages. We felt right at home. The food was outstanding, beginning with some creative tapas selections: tempura hake, foie and caramelized apple, pork and grilled mushrooms. For the main entrees, we enjoyed grilled steaks (rib-eye, or something comparable), a pan-seared hake and a grilled Iberian pork steak that was melt-in-your-mouth tender. Wine and beer were plentiful and appropriately priced. The service was excellent and the total bill was much less than you would pay for a comparable meal in the US. Don't let its nondescript facade fool you, La Mi Venta is an outstanding restaurant tucked away in the bustling center of Madrid.

Done traditional way w all kinds of seafood. Nice. 6) Grilled entrecote of beef (looks better thsn it taste...a bit tough to chew) 7) Grilled iberico pork (Champion dish, soft, succulent and porky...well chargrilled and smoky) 8) Grilled octopus (also winning dish) Conclusion : No wonder this little tavern is so highly rated on TA. Traditional yes...but food is good! Except the beef.

When paying we were told that as we didn't have dessert, we should have a homemade chocolate liqeur shot on the house. Fantastic food, service and atmosphere. We would both highly recommend this place to anyone and hope they continue exactly as they are providing a great experience. :)

All good choices, however the Presa stood out and being something unique and really special. David was our waiter, who was attentive and passionate about the restaurant and its food. He had a great sense of humour and made the evening such fun. We will definitely be returning, not only to see the legend which is David but also to devour another Presa at such good value.

Sitting in the March sunshine in Madrid, we enjoyed a real treat at La Mi Venta - from the Olive Oil we were given with our bread, which was truly exceptional and high-grade, to the croquetas (which were really, really good), to the rioja by the glass (because it was cheaper that getting a bottle) to the chupitos and crema di roja which we enjoyed on the house to round it off.  And it was ridiculously cheap too! Couldn't believe it when I saw the bill!! The service was just as good as the food - very friendly and helpful (I suspect my sister's spanish ramblings helped with this!). Will ABSOLUTELY be revisiting this restaurant when I return to Madrid - brilliant!

review_preview: Decided to give El Sur a try based on the reviews and they didn’t disappoint as I visited twice to try more of the Tapas.First visit, ordered a small El Sur salad to start and the combination of balsamic vinaigrette, walnuts and goat cheese...
review_full: Decided to give El Sur a try based on the reviews and they didn’t disappoint as I visited twice to try more of the Tapas. First visit, ordered a small El Sur salad to start and the combination of balsamic vinaigrette, walnuts and goat cheese made it excellent! The Tortilla de Patatas (Spanish omelette) came as a slice and was an egg/potato mixture-very good and I’ve seen this dish in other spots also. The special for the evening was grilled Pulpo (Octopus). Unfortunately it was chewy (& maybe this is the way it is meant to be). So possibly not cooked or brined enough. That said, the sauce made it manageable. I was offered a complimentary Cheesecake at the end of dinner which was a nice touch. Second evening, I started with the Calamari salad (Calamares a la Romana). Just the right amount of crust and the Calamari was cooked to perfection. Next was the Gambones. A garlic lover’s delight. Shrimp cooked in garlic oil so their warm bread was perfect for dipping and scooping out the Shrimp. I got a complimentary shot of Samba at the end of my meal. Amazing restaurant and bar! A laid back atmosphere where locals and tourists come together. Service was excellent. Quite popular and not very big so would recommend arriving early.

title_review: Awesome little bar, great staff, great food.
review_preview: We were staying locally and welcomed into El Sur after a day of walking the city. The bar staff spoke perfect English and were happy to chat about themselves and the bar and the neighbourhood. The next day I deposited my husband there to use...
review_full: We were staying locally and welcomed into El Sur after a day of walking the city. The bar staff spoke perfect English and were happy to chat about themselves and the bar and the neighbourhood. The next day I deposited my husband there to use the wifi while I went to to Renie Sophia Museum. He claims the place was absolutely packed the whole 2 hours with happy satisfied locals eating the most amazing food. When I returned I ordered a delicious Rojia and Johnny the owner then presented us with a plate of slow cooked beef and vegetables with THE most delicious bread rolls( on top of the free olives and peanuts.) one of the nicest experiences we have ever had in a big city. Congratulations Johnny, Alex,and Reman on establishing a great bar with great food. See you tomorrow for lunch!

review_preview: I was on tour with my indie band in Madrid, and chanced upon this place. Immediately we were treated like royalty, and served with great patience. John and his staff took their time in trying to explain the menu to us, and made sure each...
review_full: I was on tour with my indie band in Madrid, and chanced upon this place. Immediately we were treated like royalty, and served with great patience. John and his staff took their time in trying to explain the menu to us, and made sure each dish was cooked to perfection. The salad was impeccable, cold watermelon gazpacho exquisite, and the main courses left us stuffed to the brim. Sangria was one of the best I had over my time in Spain. Highly recommended, I'd come back to this place if I were ever in Madrid again.

title_review: Wonderful Oasis on a Hot Madrid Afternoon
review_preview: We happened upon this friendly little bar/restaurant near our hotel while trying to escape the 100 deg. heat. Although the air conditioning drew us in for a drink and tapas, the charming young owner, Johnny, persuaded us to return later that night for dessert and...
review_full: We happened upon this friendly little bar/restaurant near our hotel while trying to escape the 100 deg. heat. Although the air conditioning drew us in for a drink and tapas, the charming young owner, Johnny, persuaded us to return later that night for dessert and a nightcap. The food we tried (tortilla Española on our first round, and carrot cake and chocolate pie later) was phenomenal -- some of the best we had in Spain. Prices were reasonable, service was excellent, and the atmosphere was very comfortable. We were in Madrid for just one night. Otherwise we'd have returned for dinner the following evening.

review_preview: Having been to this restaurant a couple of years ago we were very keen to go back and used the online table booking system. That worked brilliantly as did the food. We ended up having dinner on 2 consecutive evenings and a lunch in between....
review_full: Having been to this restaurant a couple of years ago we were very keen to go back and used the online table booking system. That worked brilliantly as did the food. We ended up having dinner on 2 consecutive evenings and a lunch in between. To put it in perspective the lunch of 3 special tapas cost as much as a cardboard box of squid bits from the San Miguel market and was in a different league. Dinner was superb.. they very sensibly have a limited menu which makes choosing very difficult as all of the options are wonderful. To not have the Iberico pork would be a mistake but the burger was also very good..as was the hake... and the bass. They would be well advised to scale back portion size as I never got near the deserts. Service was exceptional, professional and thoroughly enjoyable.. thank you Sylvia you a credit to a wonderful restaurant. We will be back again soon.

We got to sit in what I assume used to be the brick basement room for curing meats. Our waitress was very cheerful and patient with my 3rd grade level Spanish, she also made a great wine recommendation. Nice breads and the charcuterie is house-cured. Had the seabass which was perfectly prepared. Desserts were excellent and the meal was finished off with a little Patxaran (liquor made with sloe berries that has a subtle licorice flavor) as a digestif

These guys (Johnny and Alex) are doing a wonderful job and clearly love their work - don't miss it!

review_full: I wanted to find a good tapas restaurant for my parents first trip to Europe and to Madrid, and Taberna Mas al Sur did not disappoint. Our servers William and Andres were courteous, efficient and very friendly. Compared to most other places we've eaten here in Madrid, the service staff was actually polite and helpful! The food was amazing and delicious. We ordered a wide variety of dishes for the meal. We all enjoyed the ropa vieja (shredded beef) and the pulpo a la plancha (grilled octopus) the best. The sangria was refreshing as well.  All in all, the best dining experience we've had in Madrid and a lot if that goes to the service and attention by William and Andres. We will definitely visit this place again before we leave town.

review_preview: We have had dinner there twice in the last week and enjoyed it immensely. It was recommended by our excellent hotel, the Artrip. Once we sat outside (only a few tables there) and the second time inside in an air conditioned room. The customers seemed...
review_full: We have had dinner there twice in the last week and enjoyed it immensely. It was recommended by our excellent hotel, the Artrip. Once we sat outside (only a few tables there) and the second time inside in an air conditioned room. The customers seemed a mix of locals and international tourists. We were made to feel welcome, despite our very limited Spanish. The waiter William was especially friendly. The food was good, especially the salmon, and the atmosphere was like a neighbourhood eating place rather than a tourist restaurant. It is by no means fine dining but gives excellent value. We would certainly go back next time we are in Madrid

review_preview: Last night was my first dinner at Taberna mas el Sul, and I was blown away. I went with a friend who had gone two times prior, and our experience not only lived up to the massive hype she gave the establishment, but it by...
review_full: Last night was my first dinner at Taberna mas el Sul, and I was blown away. I went with a friend who had gone two times prior, and our experience not only lived up to the massive hype she gave the establishment, but it by and large surpassed it. We ordered three tapas dishes to start, all of which were delicious. My friend, who has ordered something different each time, asserts that you can’t go wrong with any dish on their menu. Tinto de Derano accompanied our dinner, and by the close, we were happily bemoaning about how full we were.  But our experience didn’t stop there. The servers, who were all kind and gracious, and able to accommodate an English speaker, surprised us with shots, another Tinto de Derano, and two slices of exceptional cake at the close of our meal, all on the house. My friend assured me that this was something that they do sometimes at this establishment: these generous individuals seek to provide a homestyle, Spanish, traditional culinary experience. Scheduled to leave the very next day, this restaurant nearly tempted me to skip my flight. Go if you’re a tourist, go if you’re a local, go if you’re a person!

The two owners and their young staff were very attentive and helpful, without being gushing and in our faces. The service and value was first class and we will certainly go again next trip to Madrid

review_preview: The outside of this venerable restaurant near the Royal Palace is so non-descript that you could easily miss it from the sidewalk. The inside however- including a strikingly lit basement vault that looks to be centuries old- is full of charm and atmosphere and provided...
review_full: The outside of this venerable restaurant near the Royal Palace is so non-descript that you could easily miss it from the sidewalk. The inside however- including a strikingly lit basement vault that looks to be centuries old- is full of charm and atmosphere and provided a perfect setting for memorably good food and service. Our lunch, extended over two hours, included a tray of classic Spanish tapas and traditional lamb chops and grilled hake and vegetables with garlic butter. All were perfectly prepared. The wine, chosen by our excellent server, was a Spanish Albariño and our dessert an exquisite toffee style pudding with ice cream. Do not miss this restaurant!

review_preview: Had been in Barcelona some years ago and personally found the whole tapas scene highly over rated. Finally found an amazing sea food restaurant on the outskirts of the city that I should have reviewed. On this second visit to Spain felt the need to...
review_full: Had been in Barcelona some years ago and personally found the whole tapas scene highly over rated. Finally found an amazing sea food restaurant on the outskirts of the city that I should have reviewed. On this second visit to Spain felt the need to find a good restaurant, not just a tapas bar, early on. Googled restaurants near me, and this was one came up. Impressively had exceptional reviews yesterday, day before, day before that, and so it went. Always hesitant to go somewhere with so many current good reviews, but, new in town, within walking distance, nothing to lose. Don't bother to make a reservation, it's completely booked (all the hype). Just get there ( for dinner) at 7:45pm and your sure to get either an outside table or one of the "high/tall" tables inside. The hype is entirely justified. We were in Madrid for 3 nights and we had dinner here every night. We chose different dishes and wines ( always extremaduran) every night. The quality and presentation was impeccable. But, the ambience, pavement, inside, and, the vibe, that crazy La Mi Venta vibe, kept us coming back for more. This place is great, not just in the Opera district of Madrid. I think this is the best restaurant in Madrid, not being a Michelin star kind of diner myself. Really, really good honest food that is both well prepared and presented, in an addictive holiday atmosphere.  Every exceptional review to date entirely justified. Do not, do not lose that mojo.

title_review: Meson Restaurante La Mi Venta is a felicitous find
review_preview: Staff at ApartoSuites Sabatini made a reservation for us and our traveling friends at La Mi Venta on a recent Sunday evening when many restaurants were closed. What good luck!  We had a fantastic meal that included grilled chiparones, a superb steak, and a wonderful...
review_full: Staff at ApartoSuites Sabatini made a reservation for us and our traveling friends at La Mi Venta on a recent Sunday evening when many restaurants were closed. What good luck! We had a fantastic meal that included grilled chiparones, a superb steak, and a wonderful bottle of Rioja (Muga, Selección Especial 2015). Outstanding service provided by Didier added to the great evening.  We enjoyed the restaurant so much that we returned on Monday evening. Juan Antonio took our reservation and remembered us from the previous evening. Aitor was our waiter this night and also provided exceptional, friendly  service for another memorable meal that included the delicious grilled chiparones. And we finished the meal with a glass of Pedro Ximenez 1927 Alvear sherry.  We will definitely return when we next visit Madrid.

review_preview: I took a friend for dinner tonight. The first part, the tour with tapas in different places is indeed a great idea: from the cocktail bar to the cellar then the champagne sanctuary. However, we would have enjoyed this moment more if it hadn't been...
review_full: I took a friend for dinner tonight. The first part, the tour with tapas in different places is indeed a great idea: from the cocktail bar to the cellar then the champagne sanctuary. However, we would have enjoyed this moment more if it hadn't been done in a hurry. Hardly, the tapas swallowed, that we had to change place. I did not even have time to finish my glass of champagne in the Sacristy. An experience in a 2-star restaurant means enjoying and savoring and not having to rush... It is a pity that the sommelier does not offer a tour of the bodega. Knowing that I didn't want the wine pairing formula, I asked him to see several rioja and white wines. The dishes did not leave me an imperishable memory, except for the pink tomato flower ice and the suckling pig with crispy skin. 2 of the main dishes were salty. The desserts were nothing extraordinary, especially for a 2-star restaurant. Once again, the ambiance and the decor are amazing, the food OK but according to me not at the level of a 2-Michelin restaurant. I was expecting more in terms of culinary experience in such a restaurant.

review_preview: My husband and I had been on a day trip to Segovia, and we arrived back in Madrid late into the evening around 10 pm. We were hungry for a full meal, not just just tapas, and this was very near to our hotel and...
review_full: My husband and I had been on a day trip to Segovia, and we arrived back in Madrid late into the evening around 10 pm. We were hungry for a full meal, not just just tapas, and this was very near to our hotel and we had read the reviews here and decided to chance that they had an available table that late at night. We are so glad we did, because it was fantastic! We arrived at the restaurant just before 11 pm, and the host said they could have a table for us in 10 minutes in the dining room downstairs, if we didn't mind waiting at the upstairs bar. It was a chilly night outside, and as we were waiting the host brought us 2 cups of some homemade chicken broth to warm us up until we could be seated. It was absolutely delicious, and had us looking forward to the actual meal! Our waiter was fantastic and super attentive, he helped us to pick out a great bottle of wine-letting us sample a few choices first to see what we liked- and recommended the Chuleton de Carne Roja a la Parrilla de Carbon, an approx. 1 kilo serving of steak, which was delicious and cost €40. We tried a great olive oil, which they also sold by the bottle and came packaged in a nice box(we regretted not buying one to take home with us), a salad which was very good, but no room left for any dessert.   They also had the full menu in both English and Spanish. Overall great experience, and a perfect meal. We would definitely return if we are in Madrid again!

review_preview: Went to La Mi Venta last night. Quite late after a concert at auditorio but we had a warm welcome from the friendly, helpful staff.They specialise in grilled meat accompanied by excellent wine. (I've been told the gin and tonic is outstanding but we...
review_full: Went to La Mi Venta last night. Quite late after a concert at auditorio but we had a warm welcome from the friendly, helpful staff. They specialise in grilled meat accompanied by excellent wine. (I've been told the gin and tonic is outstanding but we did not venture) We ate the delicious lamb chops and shared succulent goat which was tender, moist and falling off the bone. The best I've ever eaten. (Not the first either!) The wine also was first class and reasonably priced for that quality. I will certainly explore the list further at another visit.  Staff attentive but not obtrusive.  Very near to Plaza Espania it is also convenient for that part of town. Worth a cab ride though, if you are staying further afield. We did not book but I will next time to avoid possible disappointment.

review_preview: One of the best meals of my life.  Roberto, greeted me, asked if I just wanted tapas, or a complete meal.  I wanted a complete meal, and he ushered me downstairs to 'the cave', to what appeared to be the best table in the restaurant....
review_full: One of the best meals of my life.  Roberto, greeted me, asked if I just wanted tapas, or a complete meal. I wanted a complete meal, and he ushered me downstairs to 'the cave', to what appeared to be the best table in the restaurant. The cave hundreds of years ago, was a secret passage from the Royal palace to the church. It is now a church of culinary delights. The service:  The service was the best I've ever had. I usually eschew 'fine dining' places because of the stuck up service. Roberto embraces the importance of his job. For a foodie, having a 'waiter' who is completely knowledgable about product sourcing and will to spend as much as necessary, in multiple languages, to explain and describe the menu items and their sourcing is a rare find.  What is rarer was his sharing the 'joy' of my enjoyment of the food. Not only was the food incredible creative and balanced, but his timing of the meal was spot on. His genuine enjoyment of my enjoyment of the various dishes made him a partner in my meal, not just a 'waiter' or a 'server'. As for the meal itself, each dish was astoundingly well balanced. Not only in the spicing, but also in the temperature, and the quantities. Every dish had the correct amount of food so that there was the perfect amount of the various ingredients for every bite. The meal started off with a cup of hot pork bone broth - which Roberto informed me they give all of their customers during the winter months to warm them up. It was delicious. Next home baked bread with olive oil. I noticed how green the olive oil was and Roberto explained that it is world rated olive oil pressed in southern Spain. Just the first light pressing in the bottles. As he is telling me about the sourcing the fragrance wafts from the little bowl and catches my attention. It's wonderful olive oil, silky mouth, expands aromaticalily with a mild bite at the end. I order tomatoes with olive oil, garlic and a lovely flaked sea salt that give a nice little crunch along with a mini-explosion of flavor. Balance with a surprise in every bite. A 4 dimensional meal.  Then came the porterhouse steak. Cooked perfectly rare, and already sliced (a la Peter Lugers). Unfortunately Beef like this is no longer available in the USA. Chocolate mousse was the best I've ever had. Once again it was 4 dimensional. It had an almond cookie, with mousse on top of that with homemade (this morning) pistachio ice cream topped off with a slice of 70% dark cocoa chocolate with flakes of sea-salt on top. The textures hit the fork, and once in the mouth hit the tongue and the tooth (it was al-dente - if you could imagine such a thing). The meal finished off with a complementary bottle of ice cold coffee cream liquor. Roberto described it as Bailey's but they make it themselves (because baileys is too sweet). It was unctuous. This was one of the best meals I've had. The mousse, the best I've ever had. I highly recommend this place.

review_preview: In every city we go to, we try one Fine Dining restaurant to go with the street food and local favourites. Very often these meals turn out to be expensive parodies of local food with random flourishes of truffles and caviar. So we were a...
review_full: In every city we go to, we try one Fine Dining restaurant to go with the street food and local favourites. Very often these meals turn out to be expensive parodies of local food with random flourishes of truffles and caviar. So we were a little bit apprehensive even booking a nice restaurant when Madrid is awash in excellent little restaurants. But my god, we were happy we stuck to our system. As an experience, Coque ranks as one of the best restaurants we have visited globally. We live between Hong Kong and Paris so I do not say this lightly. We were greeted at the door and taken to a bar in the basement. We had a palette cleansing cocktail that was part ice cream part bloody Mary. From there it was on to the cellar where we has a selection of dry wines and charcuterie.  We were given a tour of the cellar and a choice of bottles. However, we are not big drinkers so we passed on this opportunity. However the labels on the bottles spoke for themselves. This is a quality cellar. We did partake in the glass of champagne on the way up to the kitchen. At the kitchen we were offered a series of appetisers to whet our palette chased down by a glass of the local beer. It sounds a lot heavier than it was. It was more like having some snacks watching a game before dinner. When we finally got to the table we were in a really good mood. This sensation only deepened as the courses came out. The restaurant is particularly strong on the interplay between temperature and texture. Seafood comes out as ice cream. Vegetables come out as warm gels. The piece de resistance however was the dessert. The presentation is insane. A giant cloud of mist reveals a generous selection of desserts, each of which would be worthy of its own dish in another restaurant. We also had the cafe gourmand at end like total pigs. The price of this experience is not cheap, but bang in line with what you pay for anywhere in the world for this many courses and this much artistry. This restaurant is a must visit date place in Madrid.

title_review: A great introduction to typical Spanish products in a relaxing setting
review_preview: This was our first activity on a weekend trip to Madrid, and we really enjoyed it.  There are plenty of other venues that offer a similar experience, perhaps with even more choices or lower prices, but we appreciated the intimate, relaxing setting and friendly staff...
review_full: This was our first activity on a weekend trip to Madrid, and we really enjoyed it. There are plenty of other venues that offer a similar experience, perhaps with even more choices or lower prices, but we appreciated the intimate, relaxing setting and friendly staff available to offer samples and answer questions. We chose a sampler that included bread, olive oils, ham varieties and sheep's milk cheese, plus a bottle of wine. We decided to buy some ham and cheese to bring back home, too! This experience was not cheap, but we felt that it had good value in terms of the quality of the produce, and the pleasure we got from the overall atmosphere. We ended up coming back on our last day to buy more food, as gifts for family members. It is all packaged cleanly and hygenically, definitely allowed into countries in the EU, UK etc. but tourists from places like the US or Australia might want to check in advance if you are allowed to bring these kinds of items home with you.

review_preview: We enjoyed the Q19 menu on Oct. 12. The general atmosphere and approach were fun and the food was often outstanding and very creative (although the number of courses can be substantial for some and a few courses, including the peapod, red mullet, and sashimi...
review_full: We enjoyed the Q19 menu on Oct. 12. The general atmosphere and approach were fun and the food was often outstanding and very creative (although the number of courses can be substantial for some and a few courses, including the peapod, red mullet, and sashimi courses, didn't quite come together). The "wine pairings" were often odd (too much effort at trying to be creative) and not a good value (especially given the restaurant's great wine collection that we visited on our "tour"). The choices (3 sherries?) didn't pair particularly well with some courses and were generally a poor representative of the current terrific state of the Spanish wine industry. Service was hit and miss--very nice until we got to the dining room stage (after arriving at the restaurant customers progress through several other locations and courses prior to that). In the dining room we seemed to have been shunted off to the side where only about half of the tables were occupied (as were 2 other tables that also appeared to have English speakers)--that would have been fine, but the primary server there did not seem particularly comfortable with conversation (at least in English) and the "wine guy" seemed to spend as little time and effort at communication in our section of the dining room as possible (while engaging in lengthy conversations and making far more generous wine pours elsewhere).  Overall--very creative and fun experience. Based on our experience--don't have big expectations for the wine pairings and expect inconsistent service.

title_review: Amazing typical food with friendly staff
review_preview: Location: very close to Museum Reina Sofia (10min walk), you find a very typical restaurant in a narrow street. Place: tiny but with an amazing environment,  the decoration is nice and all the staff is extremely helpful and kind. Food: the BEST food I have...
review_full: Location: very close to Museum Reina Sofia (10min walk), you find a very typical restaurant in a narrow street.  Place: tiny but with an amazing environment, the decoration is nice and all the staff is extremely helpful and kind.  Food: the BEST food I have ever eaten in Madrid! We started by a plate of cheeses and jamon, followed by the main dish (calamares, octopus, beef and pork) which was superb. Fresh food with good ingredients. For dessert we tried the Nutella pie that was very tasty! It was a birthday lunch so we had a candle in a cake as well as a shot of a typical drink! I really recommend if you want something typical and not just another restaurant for tourists!

title_review: A fantastic end to our trip!
review_preview: We visited La Mi Venta after searching Trip Advisor for great restaurants serving paella in Madrid and were not disappointed! From the street, it doesn't particularly stand out but the decor inside is very authentic. We sat on the high tables at the back as...
review_full: We visited La Mi Venta after searching Trip Advisor for great restaurants serving paella in Madrid and were not disappointed! From the street, it doesn't particularly stand out but the decor inside is very authentic. We sat on the high tables at the back as the downstairs was full, but this wasn't a problem at all. We'd already decided on the paella, at a reasonable cost of 30 euros for 2 people. A large basket of bread and delicious olive oil then appeared on the table, followed by three great tapas dishes, all free of charge and totally unexpected, which was a lovely touch. Our paella was excellent and full of fresh seafood and the service from Jose was absolutely impeccable and very attentive. Finishing off the meal with some complimentary digestifs and small florentine chocolates was the icing on the cake. A brilliant meal - I'm so glad we found this place!

title_review: Don't Judge a book by it's cover
review_preview: The upstairs looked like a bar, but the downstairs was nicely appointed.  We wanted to do something great for our last night in Spain and this place fit the bill.  The food was excellent and our waiter, Roberto, was knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive.  We started...
review_full: The upstairs looked like a bar, but the downstairs was nicely appointed. We wanted to do something great for our last night in Spain and this place fit the bill. The food was excellent and our waiter, Roberto, was knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive. We started with a tapas sampler that was excellent. Salad with grilled goat cheese was also excellent. The Main courses were pork shoulder, hake, and our friends shared a huge Tbone. Everything was EXCELLENT! The chocolate mousse was very good too, although we could barely fit it in as the portions for the meal were generous. They even offered chocolate candy to finish off the meal. A wonderful dining experience for 4 non foodies.

review_preview: My wife and I were desperate to find a good restaurant that served 'paella' during our five day visit to Madrid.  After searching TripAdvisor, we discovered La Mi Venta that had great reviews and made reservations for 8 pm on Sunday evening (the restaurant is...
review_full: My wife and I were desperate to find a good restaurant that served 'paella' during our five day visit to Madrid. After searching TripAdvisor, we discovered La Mi Venta that had great reviews and made reservations for 8 pm on Sunday evening (the restaurant is open from 8 pm until 2 am). Upon arrival shortly before 8 pm, we were greeted very warmly by the restaurant staff and enjoyed a glass of wine in the bar area before the Maitre d escorted my wife and I to the cellar dining area which was very cosy and very inviting. In the cellar area where we were seated, there were three tables for 2 people and another two tables for four people. The two waiters served us were absolutely great; very professional to the detail and both were very congenial and you could see how they each took great pride in their profession. My wife and I ordered the paella which takes about 40 minutes but while waiting for our main dish, we had a great starter and a great bottle of Rioja wine. When we were served our paella it was absolutely delicious and certainly the best paella I have had during my visits to various places in Spain. It was an absolute fantastic evening; the service impeccable; the food absolutely mouthwatering and the ambience an absolute delight. This restaurant definitely comes with my highest recommendations; reservations are a definite must; especially if you want to enjoy the wonderful surroundings of the cellar.

title_review: Who would have guessed cured hams could be soooo good
review_preview: We stopped here as part of the Madrid Authentic Tapas and History Walking Tour for a dinner tour. Wow who would have guessed. Our guide Pedro kept telling us this was the highest quality cured hams - well we believed him as the food was...
review_full: We stopped here as part of the Madrid Authentic Tapas and History Walking Tour for a dinner tour. Wow who would have guessed. Our guide Pedro kept telling us this was the highest quality cured hams - well we believed him as the food was a combination of various salami, chorizos, cheeses, wines and finally the iberico black hoofed ham. This was our first experience with hams cured for 5 years and while we sampled cured ham for the next three weeks in Spain NONE matched the flavors of our first experience. Pricy sure but sooo much excellent flavor. Then to top it off they had an olive oil that won a first prize. Well we left the place with a small bottle to bring back to the US - now we need some yummy crusty bread. This is not olive oil for cooking but for enjoying with either bread or as part of a very good salad dressing.  Just do yourself a favor and stop in for a little taste of their top quality ham and olive oil plus the cheeses are very good as well.

title_review: Jamon Tasting at very reasonable prices!
review_preview: We had Jamon ‘tasting’ at the Mercado Jamon Iberico one afternoon and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  Luismi at the shop was helpful and friendly and took time to explain the history and process of the Iberico ham.  We tried a variety of meats over a bottle...
review_full: We had Jamon ‘tasting’ at the Mercado Jamon Iberico one afternoon and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Luismi at the shop was helpful and friendly and took time to explain the history and process of the Iberico ham. We tried a variety of meats over a bottle of wine. Our selection included: 4 yrs and 5 yrs cured ham Salami chorizo pork loin Truffle sausage Cheese and bread It was a lovely way to spend the afternoon. This shop has classes for ham cutting too! The prices are reasonable and the experience was great. If you are in Madrid, you must come to this place! Ask for Luismi.

title_review: WOWZA.  What a Great Jamon Shop

We had a very enjoyable lunch and will stop there again before we head home.

review_preview: So far, this is the most unique Michelin experience I've had. An adventure that begins at the restaurant's bar, goes on to their amazing wine room, another surprise awaits by the kitchen - and finally in the main room the whole feast takes place. The...
review_full: So far, this is the most unique Michelin experience I've had. An adventure that begins at the restaurant's bar, goes on to their amazing wine room, another surprise awaits by the kitchen - and finally in the main room the whole feast takes place.  The decor, the atmosphere, even the plates - every small detail is planned to compliment the food which is worth every euro. As amazing as the whole thing is, and as much as the waiters are trying, their English is just not good enough and that's a shame. I realize that in most restaurants in Madrid we got lucky if we found one waiter who knew a few words in English at all. Here they tried their best, but we had a hard time communicating and truly understanding everything. In such high level restaurant, where they put so much effort in the whole experience, a non-Spanish guest feels a bit lost and lacks the ability to fully understand everything that is going on. This is the only reason they lost 1 point on service for us. I have no idea how this can be fixed, but at least come prepared, and don't forget your Google translate app - just in case :)

Over there it just doesn’t go about the table meals service creativity. It’s all about creative build up of experience - preludium to an excellent menu. It’s charming, sophisticated with huge doze of variety. You visit different parts of restaurant before you are seated! Amazing from logistics perspective but it worked! And the restaurant was pretty complete. Extremely professional service. A Lady who was our host Esther very professional, knowledgable, elegant, tactful. The same goes about sommelier whose name we have forgotten. And from what I could see it related very much to the whole team. Chef welcoming !not acting like super star. Creativity and variety in menu truly surprised us! We loved vendomme but this is an incredibly strong competitor !!!!!

title_review: A culinary experience in the heart of Madrid
review_preview: Coque is a fantastic experience in more ways than one. The experience starts upon arrival where you are greeted and taken downstairs to their bar for a drink and the first nibbles of the chef's artful delicious food. Then you're taken into the modern wine...
review_full: Coque is a fantastic experience in more ways than one. The experience starts upon arrival where you are greeted and taken downstairs to their bar for a drink and the first nibbles of the chef's artful delicious food. Then you're taken into the modern wine cellar where you can appreciate a pretty amazing collection of Spanish and French wines. If you know your wines, this is pretty much a museum. There you have two more finger appetizers and you return upstairs for a visit to the kitchen, meet the chef and finish off with the last of the appetizer bites. Finally you arrive at your impeccable table, where you pick the full or half testing menu. There a team of staff members and their fabulous sommelier (one of the Sandoval brothers) guides you through your choices as they arrive at your table. The whole experience is impressive, for the atmosphere, the food, the wines and the staff.

title_review: Best in Madrid. This should be a 3 star restaurant!
review_preview: Had dinner with my wife at Coque. The experience was surprising, as we got a tour of the bar, wine cellar and kitchen and were given cocktails and food at each place. The kitchen was impeccable and we got a chance to interact with the...
review_full: Had dinner with my wife at Coque. The experience was surprising, as we got a tour of the bar, wine cellar and kitchen and were given cocktails and food at each place. The kitchen was impeccable and we got a chance to interact with the staff there. We then went to our table and had a tasting menu that was out of this world. White glove service, high-quality fresh ingredients and a diversity of cooking techniques made the night for us. Service was the best I saw in Madrid, way above the rest. I applaud this great effort and look forward to hearing the news about a third star very soon.

review_preview: It is just a little place found on a small back street in Madrid, but it is so worth checking out. My fiance and I dined here for dinner during our stay in the city and we had the most amazing dinner. I had the...
review_full: It is just a little place found on a small back street in Madrid, but it is so worth checking out. My fiance and I dined here for dinner during our stay in the city and we had the most amazing dinner. I had the beef tenderloin and goat cheese which was cooked perfectly. The meat was tender, juicy, and all around one of the most flavorful cuts of tenderloin I have had. My fiance got the raviolis stuffed with spinach and goat cheese. The creme sauce that came with was extraordinary. The small atmosphere made our dinner feel very cozy. We both commented on how authentic the menus was with things like grilled octopus and beef tartar and a wonderful cocktail and wine menus filled with many delicious spanish wines. They ended our meal with a complementary shot of spanish creme liquor which was such a nice touch. I can not say enough about the food, the staff or the atmosphere. If you're looking for a unique and authentic place to eat some delicious local food then this place is a must! We will definitely be coming back.

review_preview: Wow! This 2-star Michelin restaurant made for such an interesting and memorable evening.....like no restaurant we have ever visited. It was an over the top experience! 27 courses by the way but who is counting....As you enter the restaurant you are escorted to an elevator...
review_full: Wow! This 2-star Michelin restaurant made for such an interesting and memorable evening.....like no restaurant we have ever visited. It was an over the top experience! 27 courses by the way but who is counting....As you enter the restaurant you are escorted to an elevator that takes you downstairs to a bar where things begin..a couple of tapas and beverage and then off to the next stop....the wine room. Here we enjoyed some sherry and tapas while we selected our red wine for the evening. Next stop was the champagne cellar for a bit of bubbly before making our way to the kitchen for a hands on view of the action with more tapas and beverage. Only now do we head to our dinner table after course #12! The remaining 15 are at the table which doesn’t count the bread option where you are offered 4 different olive oils and 4 different salt choices. Crazy! The remainder of the menu offered a bit of everything all done so meticulously with the highlight being roasted suckling pig which was mind blowing! Everything was sooo delicious! Service was stellar! Alberto was awesome and definitely enhanced the experience. Overall an unbelievable experience! 3.5 hours later we roll back to the hotel.

review_preview: What a wonderful dining experience.  An immersive experience as you get to tour the premises  too!- drinks and amouse bouche in the bar, the wine cellar, the champagne area and the kitchen. You get a little presentation in each area which is a different  dining...
review_full: What a wonderful dining experience. An immersive experience as you get to tour the premises too!- drinks and amouse bouche in the bar, the wine cellar, the champagne area and the kitchen. You get a little presentation in each area which is a different dining experience and most interesting and enjoyable . Only then are you escorted to the dining room for your main tasting menu which offers some delightful and innovative dishes- all wonderfully presented to table. Foodie drama and theatre guaranteed ! The only dish that I felt was 'standard' was the suckiling pig- tho I can understand why it is on the menu as it is a very important traditional dish of the City/region. The rest of the meal was exceptional. Wine pairings available or make your own selection from a pretty amazing wine cellar ! Exceptional service. This is a 2 star Michellin restaurant and so a reservation is necessary- as is yiur credit card- Chefs menu is €195 and wine pairings an additional €125. However it is an exceptional immersive dining experience.

review_preview: This restaurant is as much an adventure as a meal! When you arrive you are seated at the bar and have a few delicious snacks and a welcome cocktail. Then you are escorted to the wine cellar for a demonstration of sherry pouring and more...
review_full: This restaurant is as much an adventure as a meal! When you arrive you are seated at the bar and have a few delicious snacks and a welcome cocktail. Then you are escorted to the wine cellar for a demonstration of sherry pouring and more snacks. Then to the champagne cellar for champagne and more snacks. Next stop is the kitchen - beer and snacks and last stop in back of kitchen more drink and snacks.... Then you are seated at the main dinner for a 12 course meal. All small bites and very innovative- you will love some and maybe not love them all. But you will appreciate the innovation and adventure! We did the wine pairings and so we had Akita’s of interesting wines. Our favorite courses were the sashimi and the pig - the later was a reimagined specialty of the area. Leave room to eat this! Desserts were fun! Most amazingly this extravagant dinner and complex stops throughout the restaurant took only a bit over two hours - not rushed at all just perfectly timed and coordinated. Try it.... you are sure to enjoy the experience even if you may not like every innovative bite....

review_preview: Madrid has so many fantastic restaurants, and the refreshing aspect is that they are not full of the pretension and self-importance that is so typical of restaurants in many other cities. As a result, I seldom spend much time pursuing dining experiences in the more...
review_full: Madrid has so many fantastic restaurants, and the refreshing aspect is that they are not full of the pretension and self-importance that is so typical of restaurants in many other cities. As a result, I seldom spend much time pursuing dining experiences in the more internationally acclaimed establishments in the city.  Coque. however, was a pleasant surprise, as the food was excellent and the progression of the dinner through the various areas of the bar, wine cellar, kitchen and then dining room was very well orchestrated, and enjoyable.  My guest and I did the wine pairing with the menu and the sommelier did an excellent job of introducing some very interest bottles to the mix, including Spanish Finos and Amontillados which I really enjoy.  Prepare yourself for a long evening - we were there 3.5 hrs - but the service is excellent.  By no means would this restaurant be in my regular monthly rotation (given the duration and complexity of the dining experience) but it would certainly be on my short list when visiting Madrid.

As situated near Palacio Real and Opera, so in touristic center, and also considering mentioned above, could be one of the best restaurant for the tourist, who would like to have the impression of local food in Madrid.  Advisable to make reservation before the visit.

review_preview: As soon as you walk into this place, you notice the waiters/servers are just so really nice to you, so welcoming and pay attention to you like you're the queen of England! We were immediately seated, served with a basket of bread, given so much...
review_full: As soon as you walk into this place, you notice the waiters/servers are just so really nice to you, so welcoming and pay attention to you like you're the queen of England! We were immediately seated, served with a basket of bread, given so much attention that we almost felt spoilt! We asked for a table outside but since one wasn't available, we were seated inside. However, as soon as an outdoor table became available, the servers immediately let us know and moved us outside. The sangria was good, the ropas veija was really yum, the risotto was nice (although I've had better), the salmon tartar was decent. On the whole, great service and good food makes me want to go back to this place again!

A gastronomical experience for the entire family!  We enjoyed the mushroom risotto with crispy bacon, the curry chicken, the...
review_full: We arrived in Madrid today from Barcelona and I picked this restaurant based on proximity to our apartment and the reviews on trip advisor. Wow. Amazing! A gastronomical experience for the entire family! We enjoyed the mushroom risotto with crispy bacon, the curry chicken, the shrimp, the Cuban flank steak and the steak with potatoes. Oh and grilled veggies with warm goat cheese. All of that plus three drinks for under 70 euro. It was the best dinner we have had in Spain and the least expensive! Our waiter Gustavo was very helpful and friendly with our lack of Spanish speaking skills. I would highly recommend this restaurant!! Delicious!!

title_review: Amazing Food, Best Service, Highly Recommended
review_preview: My family and I have been travelling around in Europe (Amsterdam, Belgium, France and Spain), and I have to say that this is one of the best restaurants we tried so far (trust me, we tried many of those recommended in tripadvisor).My father rated...
review_full: My family and I have been travelling around in Europe (Amsterdam, Belgium, France and Spain), and I have to say that this is one of the best restaurants we tried so far (trust me, we tried many of those recommended in tripadvisor). My father rated it as having the best food he had in Europe so far.  I rated it with best service (food came reallyyyy fast although the restaurant was full and the owners and waiters were very hospitable, friendly and helpful) So this is what we ordered to share amongst 4 people:  1. Mediterranean salad 2. Grilled squid 3. Flank (chef recommended) 4. Salmon tempura skewers 5. Grilled prawns with garlic 6. Chicken curry 7. Cod fish  8. And last, we received free cake for dessert. Because couldn't finish what we ordered (we ordered way too much food), so the owners thought that we were not satisfied with the food and insisted on giving us a free cake (which we finished of course because it was so good) The restaurant was packed with tourists and locals and they all seemed to enjoy their food too. Other positive points: 1. It is located in a great neighbourhood, good to have a stroll after your big meal when the weather is good. 2. Very reasonably priced 3. Have english written menu (we noticed some restaurants don't) 4. Wide variety of Spanish& Mediterranean food choices (from seafood to meat to paella)

review_preview: After reading so many positive reviews I was expecting to be bowled over by this 2 star restaurant.The evening began so well, the restaurant is beautiful and the concept of taking a tour with appetisers in the bar, bodega, kitchen and bakery (already described...
review_full: After reading so many positive reviews I was expecting to be bowled over by this 2 star restaurant. The evening began so well, the restaurant is beautiful and the concept of taking a tour with appetisers in the bar, bodega, kitchen and bakery (already described at length by other reviewers) is interesting and very enjoyable. The Bodega in particular is spectacular and we would have enjoyed more time there to browse the wine collection. When finally seated in the dining room for the tasting menu the service from the waiting staff was friendly, professional and faultless.  The disappointment for us began with some of the wines offered by the young sommelier. After seeing the Bodega we expected to be introduced to some excellent wines during our meal - but sadly this was not the case and we now wish we had simply chosen a good bottle from the Bodega ourselves. (The previous evening at another establishment - 1 star - we had been blown away by the wine pairing). The food was certainly innovative, beautifully presented (except for the very simple and ubiquitous suckling pig) and mostly enjoyable, although the dessert, whilst theatrical, was not special. It is a fact of life that when arriving at an expensive 2 star restaurant, one´s expectations are already sky high - and unfortunately on this occasion we left somewhat deflated.

review_preview: I lack the words to describe what an amazing experience it was dining at Coque with a friend. The food is outstanding, as you would expect from a Michelin 2-star. But beyond that, the entire experience is whimsical and fun. You're not just sitting in...
review_full: I lack the words to describe what an amazing experience it was dining at Coque with a friend. The food is outstanding, as you would expect from a Michelin 2-star. But beyond that, the entire experience is whimsical and fun. You're not just sitting in a dining room eating imaginative food. You are moving throughout the restaurant and are part of the experience. Your only option is the tasting menu. When we went, it was called Q18+, 18 courses at 195 Euros per person. (It's not cheap.) We went with the recommended wine pairings for an additional 115 Euros per person (though you could also go with a bottle from their wine room). You start in the bar for the first three courses (cocktail, bloody mary ice cream, chip with guacamole and foie). Then to the wine cellar for three more courses (sherry, bread with bull sausage, paprika macaron). Then into the champagne room (champagne grape, mimosa). Then to the kitchen for a beer, prawn, and an inventive take on Spanish omelet. So you're only about halfway finished by the time you move to the main dining room for the remainder of the food parade, which includes prawns, octopus, bluefin tuna, tripes, suckling pig, then an assortment of small desserts. As you would expect, the service is top notch -- you can't walk to the bathroom without being escorted by one or two of the workers. The food is creatively presented. It is fun, delicious, and memorable. They are creative takes on Spanish cuisine. Some parts might feel a little gimmicky, but it's fun. You'll need a reservation. We made ours a few days ahead of time, and they were booked, but we asked to be placed on the waitlist and were fortunate that something opened up and we got in. Yes, it is expensive, but it is also a meal you will never forget.

title_review: New location, and an even better dining experience
review_preview: We dined at Coque several times when it was in Humanes de Madrid, a suburb requiring a 30-45 minute drive from the city. Now that it has relocated to central Madrid it's easy to access from hotels via a short taxi ride. The new location...
review_full: We dined at Coque several times when it was in Humanes de Madrid, a suburb requiring a 30-45 minute drive from the city. Now that it has relocated to central Madrid it's easy to access from hotels via a short taxi ride. The new location is really impressive- high ceilings, beautiful wall coverings, lots of marble, all elegant and modern. The din go. experience begins with a cocktail and two amuses in the bar area. Then one moves to the wine "cellar" area for sherry and another two amuses, then to the Dom Perignon area for tow more amuses. The pre-meal excursion ends in the spacious, well-lit kitchen for some locally-produced beer and two more amuses. The wine list is accessed via an iPad- we found two great wines to accompany our meal, including a 1995 Muga Prado Enea! The tasting menu itself consists of ten courses- several seafood and veggie dishes, plus a fabulous suckling pig. Our meal concluded with a set of five small desserts plus a dry ice "fountain" and a set of four mignardises. We immensely enjoyed the 4 hours we spent at Coque, and we hope to see it awarded a third Michelin star in the near future.

review_preview: Great stop after the palace. Sit outside of the weather permits to enjoy a Spanish relaxed lunch. Fried gouda stick with a cream soup like suace and tomato jam, thickly cut cured meat with fries & pedron peppers, tripe soup (savory and delicate)& mushroom presa...
review_full: Great stop after the palace. Sit outside of the weather permits to enjoy a Spanish relaxed lunch. Fried gouda stick with a cream soup like suace and tomato jam, thickly cut cured meat with fries & pedron peppers, tripe soup (savory and delicate)& mushroom presa pinchos were our selections with wine and a lovely presented gin & tonic pour. One of our best lunches due to food, atmosphere and staff. Just what you need to start your immersion into Spain
